column6: {'id': '25367549', 'name': 'Grand Serendib Hotel', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 190, 'locationString': 'Kandy, Kandy District, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.285386, 'longitude': 80.64447, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304138-d25367549-Reviews-Grand_Serendib_Hotel-Kandy_Kandy_District_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.grandserendibhotel.com', 'address': '#12 Mahamaya Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '#12 Mahamaya Mawatha', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Kandy', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '20000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 4, 'count2': 6, 'count3': 7, 'count4': 20, 'count5': 154}}
column10: Be patient and the pool will free up. It's only small but people don't spend all day there.
column12:
The view is the absolute best thing about this hotel. The view and the food. And excellent service.
The view, the food and the excellent service... and the rooftop bar.
And the infinity pool.
OK so this hotel has a lot going for it.

We'd booked in advance and paid a little extra for a (what we interpreted as) better room. We were a little disappointed to discover our family room was on the sub-level. Once we spoke to the reception they understood and installed us into a top floor room with amazing views over Kandy.
The food is great here. Chef will come out and say hello during dinner service. Breakfast is also excellent and swift.
Make sure you get a chance to enjoy the pool. Being on the edge of the world and looking into the busy green city is not to be missed. The pool is small and cute and only a few loungers so you need to be friendly with your fellow guests.
Also make sure to enjoy the evening sunset views from the rooftop bar. The music is good, the barmen are good, the vibe is good. It's just a good time!

Highly recommend this hotel for families and saw many couples enjoying it too.

Make sure you tip the bellboy. He's a good dude.

The rooms have international plugs, AC, minibar, hairdryers etc... the bathrooms have toiletries and everything you need.
Definitely get a tuktuk or taxi as its up a big hill.

column6: {'id': '25367549', 'name': 'Grand Serendib Hotel', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 190, 'locationString': 'Kandy, Kandy District, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.285386, 'longitude': 80.64447, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304138-d25367549-Reviews-Grand_Serendib_Hotel-Kandy_Kandy_District_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.grandserendibhotel.com', 'address': '#12 Mahamaya Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '#12 Mahamaya Mawatha', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Kandy', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '20000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 4, 'count2': 6, 'count3': 7, 'count4': 20, 'count5': 154}}
column12:
This hotel is a must stay if you are planning on overnighting in Kandy. 
One can oversee the entire valley from here.
Especially the traditional curries served for breakfast are really good and the service of all staff was extraordinary and extremely friendly.
I can definitely recommend this place!
column13: Breath taking location with incredible service!!!

column6: {'id': '25367549', 'name': 'Grand Serendib Hotel', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 190, 'locationString': 'Kandy, Kandy District, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.285386, 'longitude': 80.64447, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304138-d25367549-Reviews-Grand_Serendib_Hotel-Kandy_Kandy_District_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.grandserendibhotel.com', 'address': '#12 Mahamaya Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '#12 Mahamaya Mawatha', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Kandy', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '20000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 4, 'count2': 6, 'count3': 7, 'count4': 20, 'count5': 154}}
column10: Don’t get a room too close the elevator
column12:
The hotel is in a great location and staff goes out of their way. There is a nice little pool and two restaurants (which have the same menu, although they claim differently).
But many of the smaller things could have been done better. The windows have blackout curtains, but you can’t properly close them. There is no suitcase rack in the room. The doors plays a noisy tune when opened, which has no added value and only disturbs the guests in the other rooms. And finally, the rooms are absolutely not sound proof. You can clearly hear noises from all your neighbors and the hallway. And somehow people are pushing furniture around all day starting at 6 AM and ending around 11 PM.
Nice design, nice location, but a bit too restless for us.

column6: {'id': '25367549', 'name': 'Grand Serendib Hotel', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 190, 'locationString': 'Kandy, Kandy District, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.285386, 'longitude': 80.64447, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304138-d25367549-Reviews-Grand_Serendib_Hotel-Kandy_Kandy_District_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.grandserendibhotel.com', 'address': '#12 Mahamaya Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '#12 Mahamaya Mawatha', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Kandy', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '20000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 4, 'count2': 6, 'count3': 7, 'count4': 20, 'count5': 154}}
column12: What a beautiful, tranquil hotel set high in the hills. The service was great and the food/drink and views amazing. The infinity pool over Kandy is just the icing on the cake. Easy to access Kandy city by either tuk tuk or taxi. Highly recommend staying here if you visit Kandy!
column13: Modern hotel with great views of Kandy

column6: {'id': '25367549', 'name': 'Grand Serendib Hotel', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 190, 'locationString': 'Kandy, Kandy District, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.285386, 'longitude': 80.64447, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304138-d25367549-Reviews-Grand_Serendib_Hotel-Kandy_Kandy_District_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.grandserendibhotel.com', 'address': '#12 Mahamaya Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '#12 Mahamaya Mawatha', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Kandy', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '20000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 4, 'count2': 6, 'count3': 7, 'count4': 20, 'count5': 154}}
column12:
beautifully located on a hill a bit outside of the city center. Wonderful restaurant terrace with a view over Kandy and a rooftop terrace with drinks (they did however not have our first choice of drinks from the bar menu available).

Very friendly staff.

Besutiful rooms, ours with a balcony with a view over Kandy.

Small infinity pool on the restaurant level with the same view.

very good food from the buffet, both for dinner and for breakfast.

The only negative point: no five stars because of the way too loud and bad live music during dinner (in our case a guitarist playing songs like ‚Country Roads‘ etc. but off key and way too loud), played without a break (!) from 7 to 10 pm. No conversation possible, even after we had asked to tune the volume down.
column13: nice hotel - if it was not for the loud music…

column6: {'id': '25367549', 'name': 'Grand Serendib Hotel', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 190, 'locationString': 'Kandy, Kandy District, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.285386, 'longitude': 80.64447, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304138-d25367549-Reviews-Grand_Serendib_Hotel-Kandy_Kandy_District_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.grandserendibhotel.com', 'address': '#12 Mahamaya Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '#12 Mahamaya Mawatha', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Kandy', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '20000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 4, 'count2': 6, 'count3': 7, 'count4': 20, 'count5': 154}}
column12: Easy access from the city to this hidden gem and you have  the best views of around kandy from your room's balcony and almost everywhere within the hotel's premises. spacious rooms with all the amenities, Infinity pool is one the best I've ever seen and don't forget to try the both roof top bar and the downstairs restaurant which also comes with a various collection of drinks for you to enjoy. Had the best evening at the roof top bar while having a freshly brewed beer along side with chef's exquisite creation of delicious cuisine which served by a young crew who always wear a smile. Thank you grand serendib .
column13: Best View of the City, They'll assure an elegant experience

column12:
I am amazed of this beautiful hotel, which offers value for money. Very friendly and supportive staff members. From the first call for direct booking until my check out, staff ensured that I have a great experience. Gihani at reception, Nikita front office management, Lumbinibat restaurant and Dharmapriya as resident manager were among the team who made our stay memorable.
The room was spacious well equipped and satisfy all guest needs. Food served at the restaurant is not only delicious but surely affordable for any. 
I trust it’s needless to mention that I would stay at this lovely hotel only next visit to Kandy.
column13: Extraordinary and offer value for your money!

column6: {'id': '25367549', 'name': 'Grand Serendib Hotel', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 190, 'locationString': 'Kandy, Kandy District, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.285386, 'longitude': 80.64447, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304138-d25367549-Reviews-Grand_Serendib_Hotel-Kandy_Kandy_District_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.grandserendibhotel.com', 'address': '#12 Mahamaya Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '#12 Mahamaya Mawatha', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Kandy', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '20000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 4, 'count2': 6, 'count3': 7, 'count4': 20, 'count5': 154}}
column12: The true gauge of a hotel is its staff and the quality of the service they provide  - the Grand Serendib Hotel  not only ticked all the boxes, but it exceeded all expectations. From the moment you arrive until the time you part ways and check out this hotel delivers in every way. The rooms are quality and comfortable - views of Kandy greet you as soon as you pull back the curtains and it’s hard to not just enjoy the balcony outlook and sit and enjoy the city below. The staff though are simply awesome - smiles all round, caring for their guests like a member of the family!  The food quality was also beyond belief -chefs and table service staff could not be better - a winning team! The meals for dinner and breakfast were just the perfect add on to the pleasure of staying and sharing Kandy. The rating for the hotel is well earned and deserved and any visitor to Kandy should seek out this wonderful escape and the ever smiling staff who make hotel stays that level above the remarkable! Well done to all the crew and the attention you pay to those passing travellers!
column13: The only place to stay in Kandy!

column12: Unfortunately, we only spent one night in this wonderful hotel on our round trip. It is situated on a hillside with a wonderful view of Kandy. The rooms are large and tastefully furnished. The open restaurant with a view of the city was super and with great service and the food was excellent. The whole staff is super friendly and helpful. We would have liked to stay longer.
column13: A wonderful hotel with the perfect view of Kandy

column13: Great place for a stay in Kandy

Lovely hotel - breakfast was great, staff were friendly and the views are incredible! Definitely recommend. 
Also they gave our driver accommodation too. 
The pool is small but every time we went in it we were the only ones in so it didn’t matter.

column13: Highly recommend for a stay in kandy

column10: Across the street you find Helga's Folly. Really worth a visit!
column12: We were at the Grand Serendib for 3 days. The hotel is brandnew (opened 1 year ago).  The view from the dining area is really spectacular. The staff is very helpful and the food is amazing. (breakfast is a very extended buffet) Only downside was that there was a lot of noise coming from the hallway and other floors in the hotel during the night. But maybe that was because we had the first room after leaving the elevator.
column13: Brandnew hotel with an amazing view!

column12:
Amazing location, great views, great rooms, lovely balconies, and the staff were warm and professional!

The balconies all look onto Kandy lake and it's wonderful just chilling on the balcony. Bathrooms are perfect.

Breakfasts are plentiful and the menu caters to all tastes.

Very nice hotel, not very far from the city center. Nice breakfast and breathtaking outside pool facing the city. 
Highly recommended for a small rest from hectic roadtrip. They have a very nice restaurant and lounge bar with amazing cocktail. 
Only the shower is not physically separated from the rest of the bathroom, so everything gets wet when you shower.
column13: Very Nice rest from hectic roadtrip

We had dinner at the resteraunt and it was delicious. A good spot to stay in Kandy. Lounge also has a beautiful view! Reccomended for couples!

column12: I recently stayed at the Grand Serendib Hotel in Kandy, and I must say it’s the best hotel in the area. The reception staff were exceptional friendly, efficient, and always ready to assist. Anything I requested was promptly delivered to my room with a smile. The level of service truly enhanced my stay. Highly recommended for anyone visiting Kandy.

column10: Laundry service takes 24 hours. Enjoy the beautiful breakfast buffet
column12: The room was magnificent, and the bar restaurant beautiful and spacious.  The food is superb and the hotel parking facilities.  There is a stunning pool overlooming the valley. By far the best thing is the staff. Incredibly welcoming and accommodating. They can arrange tuk.tuk for you, which is recommended for the hectically busy roads. 1km trip to the Kandy Market and 5km to the botanical gardens.

column6: {'id': '25367549', 'name': 'Grand Serendib Hotel', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 190, 'locationString': 'Kandy, Kandy District, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.285386, 'longitude': 80.64447, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304138-d25367549-Reviews-Grand_Serendib_Hotel-Kandy_Kandy_District_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.grandserendibhotel.com', 'address': '#12 Mahamaya Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '#12 Mahamaya Mawatha', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Kandy', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '20000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 4, 'count2': 6, 'count3': 7, 'count4': 20, 'count5': 154}}
column12:
I regret to say that our stay at the Grand Serendip Hotel in Kandy was far from the relaxing experience we hoped for. Despite our initial positive impression from their rooftop bar, our stay was marred by a series of disappointments.

We booked a deluxe room with a balcony, but upon arrival, we were informed that the room didn’t have the balcony. The hotel promised us a double upgrade for the final night, but this turned out to be an empty promise. The room we were eventually given was smaller and less appealing than our original room, with a tiny balcony that hardly met our expectations.

The issues didn’t stop there. The voucher we received for the rooftop bar was misleading. We were told we would get a free drink and a 10% discount, but when we tried to use it, the staff claimed that only the 10% discount was valid and refused to honor the free drink. The food and drinks we had were subpar, with poor quality and slow service. We were also not provided an itemized receipt for our bill, which led to confusion and frustration when we were charged inconsistently with what was promised.

The staff, particularly the head concierge Nikitha, were unhelpful and condescending. We were made to feel like an inconvenience rather than valued guests. After numerous attempts to resolve the issues, including an unacceptable bill and rude service, we were eventually offered a partial discount as compensation.

In summary, our stay was plagued with poor service, unfulfilled promises, and a lack of professionalism. I would not recommend the Grand Serendip Hotel based on our experience.

column12: Great hotel with amazing views towards Kandy centre. We could see the temple from the balconies and hear the Perahera happening whilst having dinner. The pool although we regrettably didnt use had outstanding views. Staff is very kind. The room was spacious and very well mantained. If any setback is that the restaurants menu is limited and catered to the international tourist that is afraid of local cuisine (us not being from that category were slightly disappointed). But in general terms it is a great great place to stay. Highly recommend!

column12:
We had a wonderful stay here for our short trip to Kandy.
The hotel rooms are wonderfully appointed and make for a comfortable night sleep.
We had a lovely dinner, and the breakfast had a great array of both local and western options.
One of the stand out features (apart from the view) was the staff, they cared so much about making our stay enjoyable!

The hotel has spectacular views over Kandy and has all first class facilities. The rooms were excellent and the food was high quality. They cooked to meet my wife's non dairy needs. The staff were very helpful and friendly.
I'll be recommending this hotel to others for sure because it is good value. Pool is smallish but has amazing views.

column12: Our extended family of 8 stayed for three nights in three rooms in July 2024. The room was lovely and from the window we could see the Kandy Lake and the Dalada Maligawa. The room was well equipped, clean and well serviced. We interacted with the Operations Manager, down to the Porter and Housekeeping staff. They were all friendly and very helpful. We had breakfast and dinner at the Restaurant. There was a wide selection of dishes at the buffet and they were all tasty. Each evening there was a singer to entertain. The two two children in our party loved dancing to the music. One evening we had a friend visiting for dinner. That day was actually her birthday. This was mentioned to one of the restaurant staff and we were surprised to receive a birthday cake and all the staff plus the singer joined in to sign Happy Birthday. A few hours after we checked-out from the hotel, received a call to say that the Housekeeping staff had found a rosary in our room. It was my wife's. They agreed to courier it to a relative of ours. As you can see, we enjoyed our stay, thought the staff and Restaurant was wonderful and would love to visit again.
column13: Woderful hotel with friendly and helpful staff

column12:
If you want a stay in Kandy with a beautiful view of the city, lake and surrounding hills you won’t be disappointed here! 
This hotel is clean, bright and the staff are friendly and helpful. The hotel is set high on the hill so the views are really something to write home about!  The open airy restaurant where breakfast is served daily really captures the Kandy skyline but the jewel of the hotel is the infinity pool that also captures the amazing views! Location is great and it’s a pretty easy downhill walk to the lake. You might want grab a tuk tuk to get back as it’s an uphill hike. We loved our stay in Kandy and I would highly recommend this hotel!

column6: {'id': '25367549', 'name': 'Grand Serendib Hotel', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 190, 'locationString': 'Kandy, Kandy District, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.285386, 'longitude': 80.64447, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304138-d25367549-Reviews-Grand_Serendib_Hotel-Kandy_Kandy_District_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.grandserendibhotel.com', 'address': '#12 Mahamaya Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '#12 Mahamaya Mawatha', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Kandy', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '20000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 4, 'count2': 6, 'count3': 7, 'count4': 20, 'count5': 154}}
column12:
I’ve been traveling through Sri Lanka for the past two weeks, staying in a a new hotel each night. This is BY FAR, the best hotel I’ve stayed at during my trip. Here are my reasons.
1. For the price, you get far more than you pay for. 
2. The hotel is impeccably maintained. The rooms, the restaurants, all are spotless. 
3. The view is outstanding. As I sit here at breakfast sipping my coffee, I am in awe at the beauty of the city of Kandy. 
4. The view gets better as you head to the top floor which is called the Sky Lounge. There is a bar and restaurant serving fantastic drinks along with a variety of hookah offerings. 
5. The restaurant had a wonderful breakfast buffet and the a la cart menu for dinner was fantastic as well. 
6. The rooms. I walked in and immediately felt as I have arrived to luxury.  The bed was the softest I’ve slept in during my time in Sri Lanka. This served for the best night sleep I’ve had in weeks. The sliding glass door lead to the balcony which had a great view. 
7. The pool. This was an infinity pool overlooking the city. What more can you ask for. 
8. Location. I wanted something outside the city with a nice view but also in a quiet area as noise had bothered me at other hotels. The room was perfectly silent. Exactly what I needed before my long trip home. 
9. And last but not least, the hospitality. Lumbini was so sweet. Everyone you encounter is super kind with a smile on their face. Going above and beyond for every request you make. 
I will 100% return next time I’m in Kandy.
column13: Best hotel I’ve stayed at in Sri Lanka!

column12:
Absolutely wonderful hotel, with a fantastic pool and views overlooking the river. The staff couldn't do enough to help us, and the buffet food was exceptional!
All areas of the hotel were exceptionally clean and the bar prices were reasonable for a hotel 
Wish we could have stayed longer!

column12: The hotel is okay. Feels very dated as if there are no style improvements since the 1980's. Food is good. Service is also decent. The boat ride was just ok. We barely saw anything other than just a few birds. The worst part about this hotel was that there was an awful smell each time we went to our rooms as we walked through the hallway next to the road. The hallways tiles were also very dirty. This hotel is not at all suitable for people who struggle with steps as there are no elevators that help you get to most levels.
column13: Okay hotel - a little dated and dirty hallways

The rooms were clean, comfortable, and well-appointed. The staff were incredibly hospitable and went out of their way to make sure we felt at home. The food was delicious, offering a great blend of local and international cuisine. I highly recommend and many thanks to F&B Manager Mr Naleen , Chef Anuradha, and Chinthaka

column12:
Citadel was our mid point going towards the central hills of Sri Lanka for a survey and a staff trip to the Knuckles. Check in and out was a breeze as the staff were prepared and courteous. Meals were perfect thanks to the Exec Chef Dinesh and Sous chef. Thank you for the pre ordered cake which was tasty and consumed in bulk :) The hotel offers preorder cakes. Bar - ask for the day's special and they do not disappoint. We like to eat inside the restaurant where there's more light, but for a special occasion they go out of the way with table seating and arrangements and extra items for very small costs. 
Special note of gratitude to RM Mr Keerthi Wimalasuriya and FOM Guillame. The place is extraordinary because of you. Thank you.
column13: Highlight of our Annual Staff Trip

column12:
Great hotel with a river view and a decent-sized pool. Very nice rooms with a views of the river and the forrest across it. A very peaceful place in the otherwise busy and bustling Kandy.

Super-friendly staff and delicious food.

Very pleasant staff. Dinner and breakfast buffet had plenty of vegetarian options. The pool is open till 10pm, which is great.

Everything about the hotel is top class. The staff are at the top of my list. Nothing is too much trouble and everyone willing to help. The view from my  balcony was so uplifting. A great place to start your day with a cup of cinnamon tea. The food in the restaurant was second to none. 
I would highly recommend it.

column12: This is a very beautiful hotel, super clean, with excellent food buffets, located on a hill some 15 tuktuk minutes outside the center. A nice oasis of recreation following the hot and sometimes dirty city center at Kandy. All food seemed perfectly safe, people would eat everything, even ice cream or salad dressings. I recommend this hotel
column13: Very beautiful hotel a bit outside the center

column12: An amazing experience with beautiful pool and a picturistic lake beside a lush Green hill with lots of flora and fauna. Room was clean but watch out for mosquito as it's lake side. The view from the restaurant was refreshing at the nature. We booked a half boat plan. The buffet spread dinner and breakfast was huge with some Indian stuff. The dessert section was impressive . I would like to come back and recommend this hotel at Kandy

column5:
{'id': '970638398', 'text': "Dear Sivan,

Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback on your recent stay at Cinnamon Citadel Kandy. We appreciate your insights and value your opinion.

We're pleased to hear that you enjoyed the hotel's location, accommodations, and amenities. Your positive comments about our staff are also greatly appreciated.

We acknowledge your feedback regarding the dining experience, particularly during breakfast. We're committed to continuous improvement and will take your suggestions into consideration. We will work on improving coordination among our restaurant staff to ensure a more efficient and enjoyable dining experience for all our guests.

Thank you again for choosing Cinnamon Citadel Kandy. We hope to have the opportunity to serve you again in the future.
Team Cinnamon Citadel Kandy", 'lang': 'en', 'publishedDate': '2024-09-20', 'responder': 'Cinnamon Citadel ', 'connectionToSubject': 'Owner'}
column6: {'id': '797403', 'name': 'Cinnamon Citadel Kandy', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 4330, 'locationString': 'Kandy, Kandy District, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.3058, 'longitude': 80.6236, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304138-d797403-Reviews-Cinnamon_Citadel_Kandy-Kandy_Kandy_District_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.cinnamonhotels.com/cinnamoncitadelkandy', 'address': 'Srimath Kuda Ratwatte Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Srimath Kuda Ratwatte Mawatha', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Kandy', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '20000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 92, 'count2': 117, 'count3': 439, 'count4': 1556, 'count5': 2128}}
column12:
Cinnamon Citadel Kandy is nestled in a beautiful riverside location, offering serene views and a tranquil atmosphere. The rooms are spacious and well-maintained, providing a comfortable stay. The staff are generally polite and attentive, ensuring that guests feel welcomed and looked after. The pool area and other amenities contribute to a relaxing experience, making it a good choice for travelers seeking peace and natural beauty.

However, there is room for improvement when it comes to the dining experience, particularly during breakfast. The restaurant staff, while courteous, could improve coordination, especially in managing services like tea and coffee. On busier days, such as when the hotel is fully booked, the team should plan ahead to accommodate the increased number of guests efficiently. Better organization during peak hours would significantly enhance the dining experience.

Overall, Cinnamon Citadel Kandy offers a pleasant stay, but with improved restaurant management, particularly during busy times, it could elevate the experience to the next level.

column12:
The hotel is very big and very noisy. It is not even close to being as lovely as the photo's imply. 
Our first room was so noisy that we got moved, but the second room was just as noisy, so we cut our trip short. 
The hotel is a long way from town, up and down a very long, steep hill. You can't walk it, so have to tuk-tuk it everywhere. 
I would not stay here again.

column12: Kandy is a city in Sri Lanka known for its rich history and cultural significance. It's also a notable area for coffee cultivation. The coffee grown in Kandy and its surrounding regions is renowned for its distinct flavors, influenced by the region's unique climate and soil. Kandy coffee often has a rich, full-bodied taste with a hint of floral or fruity notes. The city is also famous for the Temple of the Tooth Relic, a significant Buddhist site, and the picturesque Kandy Lake.

column10: Take the boat ride
column12:
We stayed in the superior rooms which overlooked the river and had a balcony
Apparently best in the hotel. However the road noise was bad especially if left the bathroom door open.
Buffet for dinner was very good and much better than Cinnamon Habarana Village
Looked and tasted fresher. However let down by breakfast which was mediocre at best.
Boat trip before breakfast was good.
Service okay however could not get through to reception to order a porter for luggage to checkout
 We were on the other side of the hotel to reception with plenty of stairs to negotiate. Thankfully a cleaner ordered one for us.
Overall a pleasant experience

column12: I don't recommend this hotel at all. The room had chips on the floor, broken tiles in the bathroom, the mini bar did not work, and they only gave us a hand towel if we asked for it, if not, none. The worst thing is tomorrow, we have been charged three beers that we had not had, when the waiter brought us the bill, he asked us about our trip and we did not pay attention to the receipt. This morning we have been treated very badly at reception, which was our fault, and when I told him that I wanted to write a complaint, they told me that it could not be. Fortunately we are not going to any hotel of Cinamon in Sri Lanka and I am not going to recommend it in Spain to friends.
column13: The worst hotel in Sri Lanka

column10: Definitely take a boat ride up and down the Mighty Mahaweli River and you will be pleasantly surprised at what you will experience!
column12: Located on the banks of the Mighty Mahaweli, Cinnamon Citadel is a beautifully maintained and presented Hotel. The staff are attentive, kind and always looking to help and Cinnamon Citadel is in close proximity of everything that the ancient Kingdom of Kandy has to offer.
column13: Located on the banks of the Mighty Mahaweli, Cinnamon Citadel is a beautiful place to stay at when visiting Kandy!

column12: We had a great stay at the cinnamon citadel with family.  Fantastic location, by the River. The most relaxing hotel in Kandy. The rooms are spacious with lovely views, wonderful boat ride and high tea. Great breakfast selection. Surrounded by nature and lovely pool over looking the greenery
column13: Best hotel in Kandy with a view

column12: This is my 3rd hotel on a tour around Sri Lanka definitely one of the best so far. Food is lovely and service is excellent. Staff are all so friendly and nothing is too much trouble whatsoever for anyone. Very welcoming and treated so well from start too finish. Shout out to Ruwanthi on reception who was lovely and friendly and went and got the room checked before I left to make sure I hadn't forgotten anything. When I return to Sri Lanka I will definitely be staying here again .

column12: The hotel hospitality was wonderful!! The ambience and food were really impressive. The rooms are super comfortable and the aesthetics of the decor were nice, especially the royal family sketches. Special shout out to Ruwanthi, Tharushi, Thathsarani and other staff who were so warm to us and made us feel at home! Only complaint is that the carpeting in the corridors had a musty stink. Otherwise highly recommended!

column6: {'id': '5566703', 'name': "Earl's Regent Hotel", 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 1718, 'locationString': 'Kandy, Kandy District, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.283507, 'longitude': 80.61064, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304138-d5566703-Reviews-Earl_s_Regent_Hotel-Kandy_Kandy_District_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.regentkandy.lk', 'address': '40 / 1, Deveni Rajasinghe Mawatha, Kandy 020400 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '40 / 1, Deveni Rajasinghe Mawatha', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Kandy', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '020400'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 54, 'count2': 65, 'count3': 158, 'count4': 502, 'count5': 939}}
column12:
My wife and I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights in October 2024.

1.	Good Points
a.	This hotel is situated well 5-10Min walk to few restaurants, down the road, across the bridge.
b.	The room and toilet were clean.
c.	The staffs were friendly and very accommodating to our requests.
d.	The hotel has a bar near the restaurant. The cocktails served was good. This was my personal favorite.
e.	The buffet breakfast had decent amount of food variety, mostly Indian food of course, and it was all tasty.

2.	Bad Points
a.	I paid USD250 Per Night (including taxes) for the Luxury King room. Sadly, the room came with limited view of the Mountain/town. 
b.	The hotel does have a nice swimming pool, but it’s always crowded 
c.     The pillow and bed was just OK, nothing great

3.	Will I return again to this hotel?
No
column13: Nice Hotel But Can Be Better

column10: See if you can get a room with separate shower
column12: Lovely luxury hotel. Great facilities. Lovely rooms. Great views and grounds. Lovely buffet spread. Both European and local. Strategic location. Great hotel in a great city. The only critique I have was the shower in a bathtub. Room amenties more than adequate. A challenge for seniors.

column12: Fabulous place to stay above the friendly city of Kandy. Special thanks to Ruwanthi and sachith on reception for making checking in and out so easy. Top tip, if getting a tuk tuk back from Kandy, make sure you driver knows which Regent hotel you are staying at!
column13: Lovely hotel in a great location

column12:
Wonderful stay at Earls Regent. Beautiful views, big rooms, and tasty buffet food. Ruwanthi and Thathsayani were very welcoming and provided excellent service. 

We stayed for two nights as part of a Sri Lankan tour with H.O.T, I recommend staying at this hotel.

Beautiful hotel. Stunning views.Staff pleasant and helpful during dinner and breakfast. 
Ruwanthi and Thathsarani were amazing hosts.
Will definitely stay here on next trip ,hopefully sooner than later. 
Will suggest this hotel to family and friends in South Africa

column12: We stayed in this Hotel in September 24. This is an excellent hotel with very spacious rooms, nice staff, good view from the hotel, good quality of food with lot of variety. They even decorated our room for my wife’s birthday. Highly recommended. Would like to appreciate specially Sachith and his team.

10/10 experience ! Loved this hotel !!! So clean, beautiful and unique. Everyone was so kind. The bed was super comfortable. Rooms are huge! Ruwan was amazing and so
Helpful during our stay :) would 100% come back !!!!! Beautiful decor all around … delicious breakfast with lots of variety.

column12: The view is nothing less than both stunning and breathtaking. The location is far up in the mountains and does not have a lot of opportunities surrounding it, as we could find. Food delivery or hotel-buffet options are possible still. The pool is quite beautiful nevertheless and you will for sure relax during your stay here. The hotel accommodates a lot of weddings, so prepare to see one- or more while you are staying there.

column6: {'id': '5566703', 'name': "Earl's Regent Hotel", 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 1718, 'locationString': 'Kandy, Kandy District, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.283507, 'longitude': 80.61064, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304138-d5566703-Reviews-Earl_s_Regent_Hotel-Kandy_Kandy_District_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.regentkandy.lk', 'address': '40 / 1, Deveni Rajasinghe Mawatha, Kandy 020400 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '40 / 1, Deveni Rajasinghe Mawatha', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Kandy', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '020400'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 54, 'count2': 65, 'count3': 158, 'count4': 502, 'count5': 939}}
column12:
We dined at the restaurant during our stay. We visited for dinner and were looked after by our waiter, Anju, who truly went above and beyond in making sure our dining experience was flawless. His attention to detail and timely service really stood out and made us feel well taken care of throughout the meal.

For dinner we ordered the mixed seafood grill which was absolutely delicious. The prawns were succulent and the fish was marinated and grilled well. Will definitely visit again. Highly recommended!
column13: Great food and service, worth the price.

column12:
Comfortable stay, spacious rooms but less options for Indian vegetarians in breakfast and dinner buffet. In fact not much for chicken and lamb eaters as well. Good spread of confectionery items.

Far from kandy lake and tooth relic temple but overall location is nice- serene amongst nature.
column13: Good stay, comfortable rooms but not much options for indian vegetarians

column10: Great place to stay with amazing views
column12: Beautiful views from the balcony in the rooms. Huge beds and good size rooms. Bathroom was abit old and mouldy also didn't have hot water but it was sorted out timely. The buffet dinner was very nice and great ambience we ate outside by the pool side view. People very helpful and friendly

column5:
{'id': '970248581', 'text': 'Thank you for sharing your experience with us! We’re delighted to hear that you had a pleasant two-night stay and enjoyed the exceptional buffet, especially during the wedding celebration. It’s great to know that the variety of dishes catered to different diets, and we’re glad you had a comfortable stay with beautiful mountain views from your balcony.

We apologize for the slight inconvenience with the club sandwich and appreciate your feedback. We’ll certainly review this with our culinary team to ensure all meals meet the high standards you experienced with the buffet.

We’re also happy that the wedding festivities didn’t disrupt your stay and that you found the atmosphere joyful. Our team always strives to provide attentive service, and it’s wonderful to know that you felt well taken care of.

We hope to welcome you back for another memorable stay in the future!', 'lang': 'en', 'publishedDate': '2024-09-18', 'responder': 'General Manager', 'connectionToSubject': 'General Manager'}
column6: {'id': '5566703', 'name': "Earl's Regent Hotel", 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 1718, 'locationString': 'Kandy, Kandy District, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.283507, 'longitude': 80.61064, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304138-d5566703-Reviews-Earl_s_Regent_Hotel-Kandy_Kandy_District_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.regentkandy.lk', 'address': '40 / 1, Deveni Rajasinghe Mawatha, Kandy 020400 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '40 / 1, Deveni Rajasinghe Mawatha', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Kandy', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '020400'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 54, 'count2': 65, 'count3': 158, 'count4': 502, 'count5': 939}}
column12:
We had two nights here on our tour. There was a wedding the first night so the food buffet that night was  exceptional. It was still excellent the next night with a huge variety that would cater to any diet but it was clear some dishes like the tandoori chicken and special desserts had been made for the wedding. 
Again we didn’t need a travel adapter as the sockets were three pin as in the Uk .
Our balcony over looked the mountains. Beds were very comfortable and the shower was good. 
There was some noise from the wedding but it was joyful and didn’t end late. Staff were very attentive.
We ordered a club sandwich one lunch time that was bland.

column5: {'id': '970248764', 'text': 'Thank you so much for your wonderful review! We’re thrilled to hear that you had an excellent experience with us and that Thilina and Nimesh made your stay extra special with their attentive service. We’ll be sure to pass along your kind words to them!\n\nIt’s also great to know you enjoyed the fabulous food, welcoming reception, and the relaxing atmosphere by the pool with beautiful views. Your recommendation means the world to us, and we can’t wait to welcome you back soon!', 'lang': 'en', 'publishedDate': '2024-09-18', 'responder': 'General Manager', 'connectionToSubject': 'General Manager'}

Service here was excellent.  Thilina and Nimesh deserve a special mention. They were so attentive. Food was fabulous as well.
Reception staff were very welcoming on arrival. 
Nice pool. Great views. Calm atmosphere 
Definitely recommend 👌

column12: I recently had my mother’s 80th birthday party at Earls Regent. When hotels in Kandy hesitated to take my booking due to Bradby night, Earls Regent was not only taken my booking, but also they did their best to make my mom’s 80th is memorable one. I didn’t even visit to the place and decide everything virtually and remotely. Special thanks should go to Udari Sethunga who was with us from the beginning till the end and she attended every little request even while having her day off. Thank you Udari and staff in the banquets department.
column13: One of the best in Kandy

column5:
{'id': '970250029', 'text': 'Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback. We’re glad to hear that you had a good stay with us and enjoyed the friendly service, especially from Charuka, and the comfortable location.

We appreciate your comments about the facilities and will address the issues you mentioned regarding the AC controller and the corroded parts in the pool washroom to ensure a more pleasant experience for our guests.

It’s wonderful to know that our pool attendant made your morning swim enjoyable, and we’re grateful for your overall positive impression.

We hope to welcome you and your family back for another stay in the future!', 'lang': 'en', 'publishedDate': '2024-09-18', 'responder': 'General Manager', 'connectionToSubject': 'General Manager'}
column6: {'id': '5566703', 'name': "Earl's Regent Hotel", 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 1718, 'locationString': 'Kandy, Kandy District, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.283507, 'longitude': 80.61064, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304138-d5566703-Reviews-Earl_s_Regent_Hotel-Kandy_Kandy_District_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.regentkandy.lk', 'address': '40 / 1, Deveni Rajasinghe Mawatha, Kandy 020400 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '40 / 1, Deveni Rajasinghe Mawatha', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Kandy', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '020400'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 54, 'count2': 65, 'count3': 158, 'count4': 502, 'count5': 939}}
column12:
Nice place.... Friendly staff...  I went with family and stayed coz there was a family wedding which we had to attend at the same hotel.

Charuka was extra helpful... 

The facilities in the hotel are little older. AC controller of the room had a half black screen and difficult to see the figures. The washroom in the pool had many corroded parts. 

But the pool attendant was nice and did all to make my morning swim comfortable..... 

Overall the stay is good.... I liked the location as well...

column5:
{'id': '970250153', 'text': 'Thank you for your wonderful review! We’re thrilled to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and found our location, views, and food to be exceptional. It’s fantastic to know that you appreciated the coffee, which is indeed a highlight for many of our guests.

We’re especially grateful for your kind words about our staff. Kaushalya will be delighted to know that their service during dinner and breakfast made such a positive impact on your experience.

Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback, and we look forward to welcoming you back for another great stay!
', 'lang': 'en', 'publishedDate': '2024-09-18', 'responder': 'General Manager', 'connectionToSubject': 'General Manager'}

column10: Nothing to worry ! Come and enjoy this place. Nothing is bad .
column12:
Our two-night stay at this hotel was a positive experience. We wanted to provide a feedback because we believe it could help others in planning their trips.
The hotel staff were exceptional, particularly Chaminda in the dining area, who was attentive and dedicated to providing excellent service to our family. Sasintha, another server, also interacted with us in a commendable manner.

The hotel's location and rooms were impressive, and Darshana at the front office was very helpful. Umesh, who assisted with our booking, demonstrated great attention to detail and ensured our room was upgraded as well. 
Overall, our stay at this hotel was wonderful.

Thank you to the Amaya Hills - Kandy Team.

column12:
Hotel with a stunning view. We came here for a night out and the view was amazing. It's on a top of hill so the weather is but chilled. You can see a beautiful sunset. Pool is available but the water is bit cold. 
We stayed in premium deluxe room and room was nice with a view. It includes a bathtub also. 
Staff is friendly and Ms Imalka in the buffet area helped us alot. Food is good but can be improved. Overall stay was nice.

I would like to thank him for his service
Keep up with the work!

column10: Hotel is definitely located in a nice location. It was getting there that made little challenging, better use a driver who knows the area.
column12: Very nice clean hotel incorporating nice views. Very good place for relaxation. We were able to stay for one night. However I would recommend staying there for at least couple of nights.Really good food and Staff were friendly as well. Special thank to Chaminda for going the extra step to look after our needs. Would definitely be back for holiday. Only suggestion I would like to make is to have Direction Boards in quite a few places, although this is not a major issue, as locals are always there to guide you.

column12: Hotel is nestled top of a nice mountain and has stunning views throughout the day.  Rooms are clean and spacious enough. Staff is so friendly and attentive. Food is good but could improve flavours. Restaurant and bar staff is doing a great job,  they know how to serve and up their sales decently while making sure guests are experiencing a peaceful stay. Specially Imalka and crew were doing a great job at the restaurant during breakfast. Being served by talented ,young staff with smile faces make everyone's day perfect.  Keep up the good work 👏
column13: Nice place, great views, excellent service and good food.

column10: Great if you want to get away and stay in the hotel and hide from the world.
column12:
Jaw droppingly beautiful setting, we stayed here as part of a Luxury Escapes tour,  
Positives: getting here at sunset, and stunning views, lovely welcome drink. Great gym and even has a squash court. Gorgeous pool area, bit cold though as in mountains.

Negatives: got the rooms at the back of hotel overlooking road (no privacy really), and rooms smallish and bathrooms very small!  Smelly as well (think it was the toilet water, smelt like a sewer).  Nice decor and clean enough, although only an overhead rainfall type shower and no shower caps, so had to recycle one from earlier. Shower over the bath and very slippery, not safe.

Not located close to Kandy (20 minutes up a windy road), so no options for food except hotel unless you wanted to arrange a tuk tuk, which was annoying. Food in hotel wasn't cheap as they have a captive audience due to location.  Got excited as there is a nightclub on premises, but it's only open on weekends. The other bar was closed for a conference or something, so no atmosphere to speak of.  We ended up drinking with a few others on the large verandah.  Apparently they wanted to charge $20USD for corkage for the others to drink their own wine outside (even though we weren't in the bar or restaurant),

This hotel has great potential, but is sadly let down by a few things. Beautiful lobby. 

I would not stay here again, I would stay in the city and seek some atmostphere.
column13: Stunning views (but too far from Kandy)

column12:
Every bit of the Amaya hospitality continued! They went one notch up with the magic of their chef! Buffet spread by itself is amazing but Chef Ravindra Munisinghe made it even more special by giving us a traditional Srilankan vegetarian cuisine! The incredible taste of the spices and the taste just blew us away! Hospitality is something that is flawless! The manager Mr Dayal was so attentive and made sure that we were completely taken care of! 

The beginning of our relaxing holiday in Srilanka began here! Turn down service, to fruits and chocolates in the room! It’s amazing! It’s far away from the bustling city and that is what I loved about it! The views from the restaurant and the rooms is stunning! The mountains and clouds and the birds chirping is perfect for a quiet relaxing holiday! Can’t thank Amaya Hills team for the wonderful experience we’ve had!

column12:
Amazing service, food and stay.

All staff were very friendly, respecfull and comitted to the service.

Restaurant had vast range of meals with different cuisine that provides guests to try variety of dishes.

Rooms were nice, comfortable with mount view.

Appreciate the service and can't wait for the next booking.

Chaminda and Asiri were kindly explained dishes those were not on buffet and that can be specially ordered. Also Ravindra (one of the Chefs) advised to order anything we specifically require.

Dulakshi at restaurant reception was always with a smile and kind. 

Thank you all.

Sisil Samantha

Room no.s 89 & 90

column12: I recently dined at Sangraha in Amaya Hills, and Lahiru provided outstanding service. He was welcoming, knowledgeable about the menu, and made excellent recommendations. His attention to detail and ability to anticipate our needs without being intrusive made the experience truly special. Lahiru’s professionalism and warm demeanor elevated our evening, and we left thoroughly impressed. We’ll definitely be back, hoping for Lahiru to serve us again!

column12: Beautiful hotel perched high in the hills above Kandy. My room was spacious and well-appointed, with a balcony overlooking the pool and with great views over the hills and surrounding countryside (the sunsets were superb every night). The facilities, including the restaurant (the buffet breakfast was fab), large pool, gym and spa (where I had an excellent facial), are very good and the staff extremely accommodating, helping me to organise transportation and activities. The hotel was a peaceful place to return to after spending my days exploring the bustling Kandy city.
column13: Beautiful hotel in the hills above Kandy

column12:
Had just a one night stay here for a birthday dinner for my husband.
Lovely room overlooking the lily pond, very well appointed.
Dinner was buffet style with plenty of choices and attentive staff, food prepared at various stations along the buffet. Excellent  "hopper".
A delicious birthday cake arrived presented by the staff, much appreciated. 
Lovely pool area, would gladly stay in this hotel on future visits.

column6: {'id': '316941', 'name': 'Mahaweli Reach Hotel', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 2584, 'locationString': 'Kandy, Kandy District, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.325309, 'longitude': 80.63124, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304138-d316941-Reviews-Mahaweli_Reach_Hotel-Kandy_Kandy_District_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.mahaweli.com/', 'address': '35 PBA Weerakoon Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '35 PBA Weerakoon Mawatha', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Kandy', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '20000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 99, 'count2': 92, 'count3': 274, 'count4': 591, 'count5': 1528}}
column12:
The Mahaweli Reach Hotel was my accommodation in Kandy. Having reached it after a long day, I instantly fell in love with it. The building was a beautiful, immaculate white with the façade reminding me of colonial buildings.

Upon entering, I was greeted by the front desk on my left, a garden in front of me, and a restaurant on my right. The front desk staff made me sit comfortably in the reception area while they smoothly carried out my check in formalities.

I was then taken to my room for which I had to cross the shopping arcade and the swimming pool. The shopping arcade looked quite glitzy and had a gemstone shop from where I was almost tempted to buy a few gems/ gem – encrusted jewellery.

The swimming pool, located on the ground floor, looked ethereal, illuminated by soft lanterns placed all around it. Dip into it! It was surrounded by the garden, the Uyana Restaurant, the Tamarind Bar, the deck area and a set of rooms, making it the central feature of the hotel.

I had booked myself a Deluxe Room that overlooked the River Mahaweli Ganga, a fact I realised the next morning! A lovely bookmark, with a quote from Buddha and a Nasturtium flower tucked into it, welcomed me into my room.

The room was of an adequate size, comfortably furnished, with all amenities available, as can be expected from a good hotel. The room was quite comfortable from a sleep POV; I got two good nights of sleep here.

The bathroom turned out to be quite a different one. The bathing area was at an elevation, and one had to climb a few steps, open a glass door and step inside for a shower.
I have to admit that it was not a great design from a safety viewpoint.

Most of my meals were at the Uyana Restaurant. Indulging in its dinner buffet was one of the top highlights during my stay. You should not miss the breakfast buffet either.
The restaurant offers a delightful array of freshly – baked pastries, a variety of fruits, and a selection of hot and cold dishes to kickstart your day.

I had a drink at the Tamarind Bar too. Sprawled on an armchair, I sipped on a Mango Martini made expertly by the smiling bartender. Enjoy your cocktails while partying with friends.

And that brings me to the staff attitude. I absolutely LOVED the staff at the Mahaweli Reach Hotel. All of them were always attentive, ever efficient and tremendously cordial. Every single one of them!
I was made to feel like a cherished guest and also made comfortable as I was a solo woman traveller.

I did not use many services at the Mahaweli Reach Hotel as I was mostly out and about sightseeing, but I did avail myself of the boat cruise offering.

To summarise, Mahaweli Reach Hotel in Kandy is indeed a good hotel, known for its exceptional service and luxurious amenities. It stands out as a premier establishment.

The breathtaking view of River Mahaweli Ganga creates a stunning backdrop as you unwind and socialise in this vibrant setting. As Mahaweli Reach Hotel is located a little away from the attractions of Kandy, it serves as an ideal resting place.

column12:
We were a large group staying at this great hotel. We were in Kandy for a school reunion and attended several well executed functions at this hotel. 

However, what makes a great hotel, extraordinary are their staff. This is where this hotel truly shines  across all departments- Front Office, Bell boys, Restaurant staff and chefs and Housekeeping. A special mention must be made of Kavisha. She was exceptionally helpful with her cheerful and winning ways. It is evident that this hotel invests in their staff and training takes pride of place. 

The breakfast buffet was mind boggling. One did not know where to start- the choices available were truly huge. No one could possibly leave unsatisfied. The chefs did a great job displaying their skills and craft.

I strongly recommend this hotel if you want a comfortable and memorable stay in Kandy.
column13: Great hotel elevated to extraordinary thanks to well trained staff

column12: We were unfortunate guests in the hotel where the commode was overflowing and the wardrobe door got jammed. Spoke with the owner Asitha Panabokke and  got it fixed after 2 hours. I was awake the whole night as none of the lights could be switched off from the panel. At the breakfast met Rodney Armstrong the Resident Manager about the experience. Was surprised by his indifference and casual approach when I narrated the harrowing experience. Left a note for Asitha which was never responded. Needless to mention that the Hotel charges extra for ordering Cappuccino in the breakfast under a CP plan.

column12:
Room was not ready!!! 
After traveling from Colombo to Kandy to spend a quiet weekend. We arrived at 2pm for the checking, until 4:18pm we didn’t get the room. Had to wait 2hrs and 18minute to check in 😩 please improve the checking process.

The room is in excellent condition. Well maintained. Very clean. I am happy with what we got.

Food is very yum. Fresh and tasty.

The staff are very kind and friendly. 

The atmosphere is very calm, an excellent place to relax and chill. Specially the river that flows next to the hotel gives and amazing view.
column13: Checking was a nightmare but after that it was great

column12:
Our second visit to Mahaweli Reach was undoubtedly a good choice. We were warmly welcomed by Sarath, whom we met in 2019. The friendly and polite staff, all with big smiles, added charm to the hotel.
 
The hotel, garden, and rooms were clean and tidy. The dinner and breakfast buffets offered a wide variety of local and international dishes. Indika and Anjana, two amazing staff members, stood out. Anjana was very friendly and professional, ensuring our table for 10 was always ready. Indika went out of his way to assist us when one of our kids was sick and throughout our stay, exceeding our expectations.
 
Special thanks to the front office staff for arranging a vehicle and to Sarath for accompanying us to the hospital free of charge. Sarath's exceptional service made a big difference.
 
To improve, replacing the old and discolored grout around the bathroom sink and bathtub would enhance the bathroom's presentation, which I've mentioned to the public area supervisor.
 
We will definitely return on our next visit to Sri Lanka.

column12:
We visited the Mahaweli Reach Hotel on July 6th for the morning buffet. Although we arrived a bit late, the reception staff were initially reluctant to let us join. However, Ms. Nadeesah, the  stewardess , kindly encouraged us to enjoy the buffet and assured us that she would bring some food items to our table to save time. . She fulfilled her promise, allowing us to finish our meal in just 40 minutes. If we had followed the initial advice from the reception, we might not have had the opportunity to  have th breakfast  at your hotel and would have left looking for another hotel in Kandy. 
Ms. Nadeesah's exceptional business acumen was instrumental in our decision to stay back for the buffet. Your esteemed hotel, like many others in Sri Lanka, would greatly benefit from more staff members like  Nadeesha the stewardess , who use their common sense to attract guests. We also observed her assisting other foreign guests who arrived late, ensuring they could enjoy the morning buffet as well.

As Sri Lanka strives to promote tourism and boost foreign revenue, it is essential to encourage and support dedicated individuals like Ms. Nadeesah. We wish her all a all the luck !!
We aslos wish to  mention  that the food was quite good and the Hopper makers were helpful. However  as we had overstayted for 5 minutes one steward  informed us that time is up signalling us to leave.  I wish that this gentleman could have used a much more polite tone !!
Overall the expreince at your hotel was satisfatoty !! Damayanthie Rajapakse
column13: Buisness acumen of Ms Nadeesha ( stewardess ) at your hotel

column10: Its actually a brilliant 5 start property to stay and dine.
column12: Trust me this hotel is so dam good better than any other 5 star property in Kandy. Magnificent rooms, elegant bathrooms. Balconies facing the Kandy river is so serene. The best is their buffet of breakfast and dinner it is so vast that it would take hours to check out everything. I loved the ambience and the food. The staff is very friendly and accommodative . Special mention to the restaurant supervisor Anjana who was very helpful and the bar attender Asinka who always treated you with a smile. Kudos to the entire team. Only one glitch the restaurant area has flies during rainy season.
column13: The most beautiful 5 star property in Kandy

The staff are friendly, kind and helpful, especially Madushani at reception and the young waitress who looks after guests who sit on the veranda. column12: I've had the opportunity to stay at the Mahaweli Reach Hotel every year for the last 15 years-- it feels like a home away from home. The staff-- especially Nadeesha, who staffs the restaurant-- are attentive and thoughtful. The hotel itself, which has been a fixture in Kandy for decades, is quiet, peaceful, and perfectly situated by the banks of the Mahaweli river. A perfect base for exploring the hill country!
column13: A Great Historic Hotel in Kandy

column12:
Beautiful property on the banks of a river. We got a room with a balcony on the river 
Great service, great staff . Very helpful.
The food was excellent.
We would have liked to spend more time here but had to leave after one night as per our schedule.
If we had known how  good this place was we would have planned differently.
If anyone is looking for a few days of total relaxation and serenity, this is the place to stay. Of course there is a great swimming pools , bar etc

{'id': '957032187', 'text': "Dear Guest,  
Ayubowan and Greetings from Mahaweli  Reach! 
It is with great remorse we note the concerns stated by you.  
Mahaweli Reach  being a renowned five star establishment abides by stringent procedures of the highest quality and service standards in  assuring our guests encounter a stay  of opulence and splendor it is  as such with great concern that you've found this to be otherwise.  
Mahaweli Reach is valued and endorsed by our patrons for the cultural authenticates  our property embodies both in terms of character and the service encounters delivered to  all   our patrons,  we regret that you hadn't found this to be the same.  
Concerns expressed by you  with respect to our service standards  were addressed with the relevant departments with all associates advised with respect to this.  
Nevertheless your concerns pertaining to the quality of the  food    is of great concern for the issues encountered in terms of the meals served   appears to be unclear.  
It would as such be great assistance if you could please write to us on reserve@mahaweli.com  detailing the concerns    pertaining to the  concerns undergone by you ,  along with the accommodation  facility occupied by  you  in order that these may be addressed further.  
Looking forward to your response.

column10: Place need to improve cleanliness as well as food taste & quality of taste
column12: A nice property with very poor management  in many areas including uneven food & cleanliness of bathrooms (horrible state ) ,dirty linens + towels .This hotel shouldn’t accommodate any foreigners as it would give the wrong idea about srilankan hospitality. Service wise it’s very satisfactory & attentive (Ms.Hansika ,Nadeesha were impeccable @ the restaurant though food was very uneven )
column13: No way this hotel represent Srilankan hospiality…

column12:
First impressions - although located in a beautiful place, our welcome was subpar as we felt a bit neglected by the reception. All attention was on the foreigners who had arrived in a bus. We had to remind them that we arrived too.

The rooms were superb. Massive and spacious. Kids thoroughly enjoyed.

We stayed 2 nights and both breakfasts were great. Nadeesha served us on day 2. She was very friendly and lovely. Only negative was that she interrupted our breakfast and wanted me to post a review and include her name. 

Food was good.

Pool is huge and spectacular.

We enjoyed our stay! Could improve on staff training.
column13: 2 night stay as a local family

column10: Stay somewhere else until totally renovated
column12:
We stayed as a couple at this hotel, a long drive from Kandy , we were ready for a rest. The hotel was difficult to find for our driver but we were delivered and check in went smoothly . 
Room service and food ok , pool very good and refreshing , looking forward to good sleep .
Twice during the night the alarm in the door lock went off and I mean OFF, Maintenance can and disabled the alarm, took approx 45 minutes , totally awake , assured all good , just getting back to sleep and alarm activates again , maintenance again called , another 40 minutes .
A complimentary breakfast was given after a stand off .
Would not recommend this Hotel

column12:
Heritage Hotel Anuradhapura is an exceptional retreat in the heart of this historic city. The hotel maintains an authentic local ambiance while catering seamlessly to international tourists. Ideally situated near all major historical landmarks and adjacent to the scenic Thissa Wewa, the property combines modern amenities with a serene setting.

Our family visited for a chess tournament of my kid, and despite the busy schedule, we experienced a relaxing and comfortable stay. The hotel’s restful atmosphere was a perfect counterbalance to the event’s demands. We highly recommend Heritage Hotel Anuradhapura to anyone looking for a memorable and pleasant stay in the city.

We would like to mention the warm welcome of the CEO Mr. Sumith and the front office staff members Mr. Supun and Miss Tharushi too here for there wonderful arrangements.

column12: I’ve been to many hotels in Anuradhapura and this is my second time staying at this great hotel with excellent service! From the food to the rooms and facilities, everything is undoubtedly just great. Mr. Supun (front office manager) was really helpful and friendly and helped us through out, and Mr. Janaka (Asst. Manager) made sure everything went smoothly and perfect during our stay, Mr. Vipula ( Chief executive chef) made the most delicious food for my family and I. Most importantly Mr. Sumith Wijesinghe (CEO) was a very unique and humble person, we’ve never encountered such a character in any other hotel! He makes sure to talk to every guest, both foreigners and locals  personally to make sure everything is perfect during their stay and makes us feel very welcomed. Another significant thing about Heritage when compared to other hotels from around here is that they give their guests, especially locals, a free take away bag with pastries etc. which would approximately cost around Rs. 2000 if purchased from outside. We stayed in room no. 226 which was a newly renovated room and it was very spacious and luxurious and they have a huge garden where we spotted all kinds of birds including the jungle fowl. Highly recommend this hotel for anyone looking forward to spend their holiday Leisurely! Will be back again for sure.

column12: Heritage Hotel is situated in a serene ancient landscape surrounded by Thissa Lake. The hotel offers a wide variety of international cuisines and entertainment. The hotel's CO, Mr. Sumith Wijesinghe, took great care of my family, and the staff was very friendly and helpful. Highly recommended, and we will definitely choose it again when we visit Anuradhapura! Thank you, Omesh and family.
column13: Family holiday experiences included great hospitality!

column10: Try the food, it’s really next level
column12:
Heritage A’pura is really amazing. We love that. It is a mazing location with seeing several beautiful places at the front of hotel including Thiss wewa. The staff is friendly, caring and supportive. Food and beverage are also next level. Thanks Maduranga and restaurant staff for amazing food and caring. Pool staff is really taking care of us and specially my daughter.
We are so lucky to stay in your place . Cheers
column13: Amazing place, next level food, high hospitality

column12: We had our wedding on 07th of October 2024.we got a best wedding package and that was great support for us to do our wedding beautiful.From the first date till to the last minute they did there best . Everything were perfect and nice.The team were so helpful and perfect.The way the team did there task to keep our memorable day best they did all over task.We booked the royal hall and the buffet were extremely nice.Really im so happy to select this place and we had the wedding as we thought.And also the rooms were so beautiful they had designed the rooms for us in a beautiful way.Everything were perfect and perfect.Im highly recommending this lovely place for your wedding,parties,or any other occations.Thank you heritage team for your support to make a our best day a memory 💝

column12: This was my second time visiting Heritage hotel and it was a remarkable experience. From the check in to check out the staff service was top notch. The rooms are really clean and tidy and very comfortable. They have a huge garden that is well taken care of where i spotted the Sri Lankan junglefowl  which made my day! The pool is very nice too. Very close distance to Sri maha bodhi, ruwan weli seya…The food is excellent all thanks to The senior executive chef Mr. Vipula. Most importantly CEO Mr. Sumith handles and greets his guests in a very friendly and welcoming manner and makes sure to talk to all guests himself including foreigners to make sure everything is up to the standard. Highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking forward to visiting Anuradhapura as the service and experience I received here was exceptional.

column12:
This is the 1st time we have visited to the hotel and our visit was very good. I have got a good rate compared to other properties in the area.

The staff were very friendly and supportive. The place is very closed to the Anuradhapura city hence we could easily visited all the historical places. 

The breakfast was very good, delicious and included many veracities. We used the swimming pool and enjoyed a lot.

column6: {'id': '3177673', 'name': 'Hotel Alakamanda', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 528, 'locationString': 'Anuradhapura, North Central Province', 'latitude': 8.309091, 'longitude': 80.41729, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304132-d3177673-Reviews-Hotel_Alakamanda-Anuradhapura_North_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.hotelalakamanda.com', 'address': 'No 11/1 Nagasena Mawatha, Anuradhapura 50000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'No 11/1 Nagasena Mawatha', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Anuradhapura', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '50000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 22, 'count2': 23, 'count3': 100, 'count4': 251, 'count5': 132}}
column12:
Frustrating Nightmare - Negligence - Incompetence - Lack of professionalism – DO NOT VISIT..

To start, the issue of room cleanliness was entirely unacceptable. Despite staying for two days, our room was not cleaned on the second day, and we had to wait until 4 PM after repeated requests to have it cleaned. To add insult to injury, we were informed that we should have put up a "clean my room" board—something that was never provided, nor were any instructions given regarding the process. This basic failure demonstrates a blatant disregard for guest comfort and standard service expectations. Furthermore, the toilets were smelly, and even the water had a foul odor, which added to the overall unpleasantness.
The dining experience was equally disappointing. Even though we placed our meal order an hour in advance, we still had to endure an additional 30-minute wait once seated. The quality of the food was shockingly subpar, with many items tasting stale as though they were reheated leftovers from previous days. It was incredibly frustrating that your staff displayed such dishonesty—when we requested specific items like chocolate ice cream, they failed to inform us of its unavailability beforehand, only to serve us a completely different item, such as vanilla, without any prior notice. This type of deceitful behavior is unacceptable and undermines the trust a guest should have in your establishment.
Moreover, even the simplest of requests, such as for ketchup or chocolate sauce, took an inordinate amount of time—sometimes up to 30 minutes—to fulfill. These are basic condiments that should be readily available, and the delay points to severe disorganization and lack of proper staff training.
The pool area also raised serious safety concerns. There were no visible depth measurements or safety instructions, which are basic standards for any swimming facility. The absence of clear safety signage is a liability risk and reflects poorly on your commitment to guest safety.
The most frustrating aspect was the consistent absence of your staff when they were needed the most. On multiple occasions, if one waiter was attending to a request, the rest of the team would vanish into the kitchen, leaving the service area entirely unattended. This lack of attentiveness and unprofessional conduct not only led to inconvenience but also created a sense of insecurity, as there was no one available for assistance in potentially urgent situations, the female who was in the reception was busy was on the phone and was not paying attention to the Customer. 
Overall, this stay was characterized by consistent incompetence, from unclean rooms and smelly toilets to stale food, slow service, poor communication, and a lack of safety measures. It was abundantly clear that guest satisfaction was not a priority at your establishment. This experience fell far below any reasonable standard of hospitality and reflects extremely poorly on your brand.
DO NOT VISIT THIS PLACE
column13: Frustrating Nightmare - Negligence - Incompetence - Lack of professionalism – DO NOT VISIT

column12: A boutique hotel with clean spacious rooms. Usually mostt hotels does not have family room and Alakamandawa had a room to ascomata 4 adults which was value for money. Staff was helpful and friendly. there was a good variety of food on buffet.

column6: {'id': '3177673', 'name': 'Hotel Alakamanda', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 528, 'locationString': 'Anuradhapura, North Central Province', 'latitude': 8.309091, 'longitude': 80.41729, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304132-d3177673-Reviews-Hotel_Alakamanda-Anuradhapura_North_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.hotelalakamanda.com', 'address': 'No 11/1 Nagasena Mawatha, Anuradhapura 50000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'No 11/1 Nagasena Mawatha', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Anuradhapura', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '50000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 22, 'count2': 23, 'count3': 100, 'count4': 251, 'count5': 132}}
column12: We booked 6 double rooms on B&B and it was a great choice. The rooms though a bit worn out had all the amenities and was clean. The bathrooms especially was clean and good. The ambience of the hotel pool side and court yard was really relaxing and very good for the nice group pics we took. The service was great, The breakfast was very nice with both SL and western options. All in all quite a good find.

column6: {'id': '3177673', 'name': 'Hotel Alakamanda', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 528, 'locationString': 'Anuradhapura, North Central Province', 'latitude': 8.309091, 'longitude': 80.41729, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304132-d3177673-Reviews-Hotel_Alakamanda-Anuradhapura_North_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.hotelalakamanda.com', 'address': 'No 11/1 Nagasena Mawatha, Anuradhapura 50000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'No 11/1 Nagasena Mawatha', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Anuradhapura', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '50000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 22, 'count2': 23, 'count3': 100, 'count4': 251, 'count5': 132}}
column10: Comfrtable rooms but don't expect to eat well here.
column12: Four of us stayed here in January 2024.  THe rooms were comfortable and well equipped.  The large quite modern building included a spacious swimming pool and a large garden randomly assembled.  So far so 4*.  My rating for the catering is far lower.  The breakfast offering was just not very good at all, lacking in variety and with no helping staff in attendance.  The restaurant area you had to go through to reach the rooms, it felt very public as though included as an afterthought.  Disappointing, given how excellent Srilankan hotel breakfasts often are.  A very small bar area is there with a couple of sofas on which to relax.  THe hotel is located some way away from the Sacred City, so a vehicle is required, but that's not a major problem.
column13: A useful base from which to visit this intriguing ancient city.

column12:
We had a wonderful stay at The Rajarata Hotel in Anuradhapura, for the last couple of days on our  20 day trip to Sri Lanka.
The hotel was clean and comfortable and the staff were very helpful with any request we had.
Manoj was a  very helpful waiter. He made sure we had everything we needed and was very attentive to our needs.
The food was plentiful, tasty and beautifully presented. 
We enjoyed our swims in the pool.
