column12: I stayed at the hotel for 10 days, the hotel is lovely, very well-kept and really clean, the owners Nicolette and Anna are charming and kind, the staff is amazing!! Especially Mupa the King! I really enjoyed sitting and talking with him and hearing about his life, he served us with kindness and niceness and always with a smile, he is a really charming guy!

column6: {'id': '20113947', 'name': 'Whisky Point Resort', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 93, 'locationString': 'Pottuvil, Arugam Bay, Eastern Province', 'latitude': 6.905878, 'longitude': 81.8433, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g608525-d20113947-Reviews-Whisky_Point_Resort-Pottuvil_Arugam_Bay_Eastern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.whiskypointresort.lk', 'address': 'Whisky Point Road, Pottuvil, Arugam Bay 32500 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Whisky Point Road', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Pottuvil', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '32500'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 0, 'count2': 0, 'count3': 0, 'count4': 3, 'count5': 90}}
column10: Get an upper cabana
column12:
Whisky resort is utterly beautiful..this somewhat remote ,peaceful utterly gorgeous spot.  Where you can't stop taking photos! 

We stayed for 10 nights which we was longer than most, probably people visit for a few days which probably would be best. 

We took a long taxi to get here fome colombo! Took us 8 hours. Arranged by the resort which was very helpful and efficient. 

The cabanas - we took a risk with no air con as the fans and sea breeze we thought would be sufficient, unfortunately it was sweltering hot.  We had a lower cabana which doesn't have ceiling fans but has the standing fans...it was so so hot that sleep was difficult.. this heat is nothing the resort can do about of course and I understand and agree with the owner that air con isn't good for the planet ..so I totally get it. But its important to note how hot we felt in case this will be an issue for you..it was for us and did affect our enjoyment.  I ended up with a heat rash half way through the holiday!:( 

This said Anna was SO accommodating and moved us to an upper cabana when they were free, she did this without charge and we definitely felt cooler in an upper cabana as they have ceiling fans and higher ceilings.. so I'd recommend if going when hot to book an upper cabana..plus the view is nicer and feels more private. 

They also gave us an extra fan to help. 

The cabanas are comfy though, beds were nice comfy pillows, kept very clean and a nice bathroom:)

The beach is completely deserted, so our walks were usually just us..in paradise.  Important to add..the waves in the sea, it is a surf point of course, are powerful so you can't swim or float..you can jump about in the waves which is fun just is quite tiring ha ha as you can't relax as such. ;) 

It's great breakfast is included and it's tasty..the menu is mainly Italian and its OK, some of the dishes are a little strange in flavour and personally I didn't think all worked and we really really would have loved more local food.  We had sri lankan curry one night and it was fantastic! But then the chef didn't want to cook it again:( I think this is a real shame..as its lots of pizza and pasta.  The pizzas are amazing though ..the best pizza I've ever tasted.  But we were dissapointed we only got sri lankan food once at thw resort.  But I guess for those travelling around Sri Lanka it's a lovely great If they've only been eating sri lankan.

The staff are incredible here...Harry and the other man who worked in the evening with him plus the man who cleaned the rooms..everyone was so kind, so polite, such helpful joyful people and we absolutely loved their company and help.  They work really hard and can't do enough for you. 

Harry you're wonderful! 

Nicola the owner is great, really interesting to talk to, helpful and a real passion for the paradise he's created.  Anna is also very very helpful and kind..and runs lovely yoga classes.  I'd add that I wish we'd been told about the mediation schedule when we arrived as we would have joined every morning but didn't get shown it until 3 days before we left.  More mediation would be wonderful.:)

Overall this place is paradise..I loved it..but the lack of air con was a real challenge for us BUT we did know there was none so  there's no fault of the resort..just wanted to forewarn others if going when it's hot. 

Definitely go if you're visiting sri lanka !! It's like a retreat..just go, get under the coconut palms, listen to the waves and birds.  

Thanks to the whole team for being amazing

column6: {'id': '20113947', 'name': 'Whisky Point Resort', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 93, 'locationString': 'Pottuvil, Arugam Bay, Eastern Province', 'latitude': 6.905878, 'longitude': 81.8433, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g608525-d20113947-Reviews-Whisky_Point_Resort-Pottuvil_Arugam_Bay_Eastern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.whiskypointresort.lk', 'address': 'Whisky Point Road, Pottuvil, Arugam Bay 32500 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Whisky Point Road', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Pottuvil', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '32500'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 0, 'count2': 0, 'count3': 0, 'count4': 3, 'count5': 90}}
column12: We spend 3 nights in an upper cabana - room was very comfortable- we left the doors & shutters open at night & slept to the roar of the waves & the breeze off the palm trees - what a great way to sleep. Breakfast was very good - the wood fired pizzas were amazing ! The water in the ocean was too rough for swimming when we were there in March . All the staff were very friendly & helpful - shout out to Harry ! We did the Lagoon Safari late one afternoon - recommend this . All in all a very peaceful place to stay
column13: Great Barefoot in the Sand Stay

column6: {'id': '20113947', 'name': 'Whisky Point Resort', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 93, 'locationString': 'Pottuvil, Arugam Bay, Eastern Province', 'latitude': 6.905878, 'longitude': 81.8433, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g608525-d20113947-Reviews-Whisky_Point_Resort-Pottuvil_Arugam_Bay_Eastern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.whiskypointresort.lk', 'address': 'Whisky Point Road, Pottuvil, Arugam Bay 32500 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Whisky Point Road', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Pottuvil', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '32500'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 0, 'count2': 0, 'count3': 0, 'count4': 3, 'count5': 90}}
column12:
Just amazing would summarize it best!
Anna and the Whisky Point Team Mufaris, Colvin and many more warmly welcomed us and made our stay relaxed, joyful and absolutly worth it.
We stayed a few days in a lovely upper cabana, which has been furnished with an eye for an detail and enjoyed good sleep with the sound of the sea.
The team was just stunning! They recommended and helped with trips, offered awesome Italian Food (Special for Sri Lanka) and helped even when sunburn was an issue :)
Just book your stay and enjoy the resort!

column6: {'id': '20113947', 'name': 'Whisky Point Resort', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 93, 'locationString': 'Pottuvil, Arugam Bay, Eastern Province', 'latitude': 6.905878, 'longitude': 81.8433, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g608525-d20113947-Reviews-Whisky_Point_Resort-Pottuvil_Arugam_Bay_Eastern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.whiskypointresort.lk', 'address': 'Whisky Point Road, Pottuvil, Arugam Bay 32500 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Whisky Point Road', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Pottuvil', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '32500'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 0, 'count2': 0, 'count3': 0, 'count4': 3, 'count5': 90}}
column12: We had a wonderful time - Yoga in the morning, very friendly and helpful staff, great setting, good food. The rooms are clean and nicely decorated, the beds are very good. We were there off-season and had the whole place to ourselves. A real treat!

column6: {'id': '20113947', 'name': 'Whisky Point Resort', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 93, 'locationString': 'Pottuvil, Arugam Bay, Eastern Province', 'latitude': 6.905878, 'longitude': 81.8433, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g608525-d20113947-Reviews-Whisky_Point_Resort-Pottuvil_Arugam_Bay_Eastern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.whiskypointresort.lk', 'address': 'Whisky Point Road, Pottuvil, Arugam Bay 32500 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Whisky Point Road', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Pottuvil', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '32500'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 0, 'count2': 0, 'count3': 0, 'count4': 3, 'count5': 90}}
column12:
We spent 3 nights at Whisky Point Resort. It was the most relaxing part of our holiday in Sri Lanka.  Anna was an amazing host, she and her team gave us a warm welcome, helped us settle in and we had the most wonderful 3 days.  The cabanas are tastefully decorated with attention to detail, high quality linens, and utmost consideration to make it very Eco friendly. The rooms and entire property were extremely clean. The breakfast was good and we had our meals on the property which were delicious. The pizzas were great.
The pagodas scattered throughout the property are great and we enjoyed relaxing in them. The entire team were courteous and did an excellent job. 
We did a trip to the Kumana Park, Anna recommended a beautiful nature area where we spent an evening spotting allegators, elephants and beautiful birds. The beach is pristine and we had it to ourselves. We walked endless miles soaking in the beauty and watch the fishermen pulling their nets in with their catch of fish. A stay at this resort is a great option on a vacation to Sri Lanka.  Keep up the great work Anna and Team. Transportation to and from was arranged by the resort and we were very happy with the arrangements.
column13: A True Gem off the Beaten Path

column6: {'id': '20113947', 'name': 'Whisky Point Resort', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 93, 'locationString': 'Pottuvil, Arugam Bay, Eastern Province', 'latitude': 6.905878, 'longitude': 81.8433, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g608525-d20113947-Reviews-Whisky_Point_Resort-Pottuvil_Arugam_Bay_Eastern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.whiskypointresort.lk', 'address': 'Whisky Point Road, Pottuvil, Arugam Bay 32500 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Whisky Point Road', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Pottuvil', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '32500'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 0, 'count2': 0, 'count3': 0, 'count4': 3, 'count5': 90}}
column12:
Really lovely stay, beautiful rooms that are well equipped and also decorated beautifully.
The staff are incredible, very friendly and very helpful! 
The food is delicious, did not expect to get such good Italian food on the beach in Sri Lanka, but obviously use high quality ingredients - pizza also very good made in traditional pizza over!
column13: Excellent stay, friendly staff and great food!

column6: {'id': '20113947', 'name': 'Whisky Point Resort', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 93, 'locationString': 'Pottuvil, Arugam Bay, Eastern Province', 'latitude': 6.905878, 'longitude': 81.8433, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g608525-d20113947-Reviews-Whisky_Point_Resort-Pottuvil_Arugam_Bay_Eastern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.whiskypointresort.lk', 'address': 'Whisky Point Road, Pottuvil, Arugam Bay 32500 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Whisky Point Road', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Pottuvil', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '32500'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 0, 'count2': 0, 'count3': 0, 'count4': 3, 'count5': 90}}
column12: Absolutely lovely place. Apparently we were there 'out of season' (whatever that means?) which suited us perfectly. We had almost the entire beach to ourselves. Fantastic room and brilliant service. The staff were a joy to be with. Mufiah, Harry, and Colvin get particular mention, but everyone contributed to the feelgood, well managed, well looked after, feeling. The food was outstanding, especially the "Sri Lanka" option! We loved the lagoon visit, the game park (1 1/2 leopard spotted), etc etc
column13: Relaxing and beautiful with great service

column10: Go out early in the morning to watch the sunrise over the sea! So pretty.
column12: Absolutely lovely view! The food was AMAZING, pizza’s 10/10. The staff were ever so lovely, and the Mama’s Coconut was just mmmm!!! A good and clean hotel, with hot water and big rooms.
The pool is clean, the location is great, and above all - the staff is amazing! column12: This hotel is located in a great location for restaurants and beach access. The accommodations and service were terrible. column6: {'id': '9587644', 'name': 'The Blue Wave Hotel', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 336, 'locationString': 'Arugam Bay, Eastern Province', 'latitude': 6.88276, 'longitude': 81.844025, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g3348959-d9587644-Reviews-The_Blue_Wave_Hotel-Arugam_Bay_Eastern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://bluewatersarugambay.com', 'address': 'The Blue Wave Hotel Road, Arugam Bay 32500 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'The Blue Wave Hotel Road', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Arugam Bay', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '32500'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 13, 'count2': 13, 'count3': 32, 'count4': 90, 'count5': 188}}
column12:
This hotel has potential if only it had someone to overhaul it with vision. Currently the location is the only thing that delivers. This hotel is poor. Seriously it needs an overhaul of everything. This might be ok if you are twenty but I came with my family and my husband and I were gutted. Honestly hostels were better nearby offering shady swimming pools and comfortable loungers. (Wave bay) and Surf and Sun utterly beautiful - we escaped there during the days because hotel so disappointing.
So… breakfast is pretty inedible, maybe the omelette is ok because it’s cooked from scratch. Flies in fruit. Coffee is powdered sachets and you are charged additional for a Nescafé machine coffee but the machine broke after one coffee. The lifts are filthy. The air con in our room was broken and didn’t work we had to have it fixed. In three days no one cleaned my room until I asked in the evening. We were out by 9.30am each day … and when they cleaned no surfaces were cleaned just sink washed and floor swept. You can’t have pool towels for the beach so if you are travelling with a family you have to buy four towels!

The Pool, again it’s got potential but it’s missing basic necessities- old hard/uncomfortable sun loungers with black plastic cushions (bird poo featuring), no shade available, not one umbrella for any loungers or tables on offer outside(I asked, there were none available), I mean surely this is basic? It would take so little investment to upgrade. No service at the pool. I think because it’s low grade hotel the staff (who seem to hide in a back office) don’t seem motivated to look after you. 

Sorry unless there’s a new management, or entrepreneur with vision I’d avoid if you are a family…

Price point way too expensive for what it offers.
column13: Location is the only thing that delivers.

column12: The most awful Hotel we have ever visited. Dark dingy room which looked dated and poorly furnished. No phone in room so had to walk to reception for every query, holes in the sheets, we must have been given the worst room in the building! Had to order dinner before we went into dine and the same in the morning. Dining room also dark and dingy. Only good thing is the pool which looked clean. Believe new management taken over who have let standards slip to hold onto their money. Awful stay will not be back. Arugam Bay lovely just a real shame about the accommodation!

column6: {'id': '8439700', 'name': 'The Spice Trail', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 336, 'locationString': 'Arugam Bay, Eastern Province', 'latitude': 6.841487, 'longitude': 81.83218, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g3348959-d8439700-Reviews-The_Spice_Trail-Arugam_Bay_Eastern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.thespicetrails.com', 'address': '69th Mile Post, Panama Road, Arugam Bay 00001 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '69th Mile Post, Panama Road', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Arugam Bay', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '00001'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 7, 'count2': 7, 'count3': 13, 'count4': 43, 'count5': 266}}
column12:
We decided to treat ourselves to a little luxury in Arugam Bay and the Spice Trail fitted the bill. We loved the swimming pool and the location which was handy to everything, including the surf break. 

The rooms themselves are huge and very clean. We really liked the small things like a broom in the room to sweep out any sand that found its way inside. 

The bed and pillows were very comfortable, with a very clean mosquito net. The bathroom is also huge with great shower pressure and plenty of storage. We found the little garden useful for drying clothes on the rack, but due to the heat we didn’t sit out there a lot. 

We had breakfast included in the price and enjoyed fresh fruit and juice every morning, along with a choice of Japanese inspired egg dishes. The coffee from Kaffe out front is amazing. Try their cakes too. 

Last but not least - the staff were amazing. Ready to help with anything and so friendly! We’d definitely stay here again if we return to Arugam Bay.

column6: {'id': '8439700', 'name': 'The Spice Trail', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 336, 'locationString': 'Arugam Bay, Eastern Province', 'latitude': 6.841487, 'longitude': 81.83218, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g3348959-d8439700-Reviews-The_Spice_Trail-Arugam_Bay_Eastern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.thespicetrails.com', 'address': '69th Mile Post, Panama Road, Arugam Bay 00001 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '69th Mile Post, Panama Road', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Arugam Bay', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '00001'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 7, 'count2': 7, 'count3': 13, 'count4': 43, 'count5': 266}}
column12: The Spice Trail is by far the best accommodation in Arugam Bay. I am really satisfied by its services and friendly staff. We spend couple of days in Arugam Bay and staying at Spice Trail was the best choice we could made. I recommend Spice Tail to anyone who wants to have a more than decent stay in Arugam Bay.
column13: An amazing stay at Spice Trail

Best hotel in arugam bay , very fit to couples and family, all the staff was very kind and caring about everything! 
The room very big and comfortable, and the best in spice trail is the pool !
Good place in the center of arugam. 
Thank you very much!

column6: {'id': '8439700', 'name': 'The Spice Trail', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 336, 'locationString': 'Arugam Bay, Eastern Province', 'latitude': 6.841487, 'longitude': 81.83218, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g3348959-d8439700-Reviews-The_Spice_Trail-Arugam_Bay_Eastern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.thespicetrails.com', 'address': '69th Mile Post, Panama Road, Arugam Bay 00001 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '69th Mile Post, Panama Road', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Arugam Bay', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '00001'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 7, 'count2': 7, 'count3': 13, 'count4': 43, 'count5': 266}}
column10: Kaffi cafe at the front does the best coffee.
column12: Great location. Kept very clean. Fantastic staff. Probably the nicest place to stay in Arugam Bay so close to the action. The pool area is especially nice but this brings in all the outside Instagram posers trying to get their selfies in paradise. It needs to be reserved for guests only. You pay the big bucks you should have priority access to the facilities. Did I mention the staff are fantastic? I will stay here again.
column13: Definitely not cheap but worth it

column6: {'id': '8439700', 'name': 'The Spice Trail', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 336, 'locationString': 'Arugam Bay, Eastern Province', 'latitude': 6.841487, 'longitude': 81.83218, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g3348959-d8439700-Reviews-The_Spice_Trail-Arugam_Bay_Eastern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.thespicetrails.com', 'address': '69th Mile Post, Panama Road, Arugam Bay 00001 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '69th Mile Post, Panama Road', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Arugam Bay', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '00001'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 7, 'count2': 7, 'count3': 13, 'count4': 43, 'count5': 266}}
column10: Watch out for the bird poo round the pool!
column12:
This was the second most expensive hotel we stayed in out of 7 in Sri Lanka and in our opinion this was not value for money and the only one we would not recommend to friends or return to. 

The selling point of the hotel is the location with it being right on the main strip. 

The rooms are very large and the air conditioning is good but other than that they're very basic and really dark! The bed was comfy but the sheets were old and felt and looked a bit dirty. The bathroom was functional but dated. We had ants crawling all over the bedside table and this hotel was the only place I got bitten while I slept despite the mosquito net. The pool area is nice but having to dodge the bird poo while sat on the sun lounger or in the pool was not enjoyable and something we haven't experienced anywhere else ever. 

The lunch menu was basic, took a long time to be made and was very small. We went for the chicken and chips as we were in a rush before a safari and it was Happy Meal size. Luckily we didn't bother with the breakfast included option and just paid for breakfast one morning which was really poor. There were much better options just outside of the hotel that are much much cheaper. 

Each evening when we came back from dinner out there was a frog in our room and all over the front door which was very annoying. 

We also found the hotel staff the most unfriendly and unhelpful compared with everywhere else we stayed. Be aware the hotel is all sand and the staff don't help with bags.

Not necessarily a problem but we were in room 1 and were woken up by the call to prayers at 5am ish as it was just so loud and took us by surprise. 

Overall we were really disappointed with this hotel. Should have stayed at the hostel we originally booked which was less than half the price!

column6: {'id': '8439700', 'name': 'The Spice Trail', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 336, 'locationString': 'Arugam Bay, Eastern Province', 'latitude': 6.841487, 'longitude': 81.83218, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g3348959-d8439700-Reviews-The_Spice_Trail-Arugam_Bay_Eastern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.thespicetrails.com', 'address': '69th Mile Post, Panama Road, Arugam Bay 00001 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '69th Mile Post, Panama Road', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Arugam Bay', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '00001'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 7, 'count2': 7, 'count3': 13, 'count4': 43, 'count5': 266}}
column12: The Spice Trail is a gorgeous hotel in the heart of Arugum Bay across the road from the beach. We aren’t surfers so the pool was important to us and we spent most days there. The beach isn’t really for sitting on but amazing if you like to surf. The hotel rooms are huge and the shower in the bathroom was amazing. We had a great few days here - really liked it

column6: {'id': '8439700', 'name': 'The Spice Trail', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 336, 'locationString': 'Arugam Bay, Eastern Province', 'latitude': 6.841487, 'longitude': 81.83218, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g3348959-d8439700-Reviews-The_Spice_Trail-Arugam_Bay_Eastern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.thespicetrails.com', 'address': '69th Mile Post, Panama Road, Arugam Bay 00001 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '69th Mile Post, Panama Road', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Arugam Bay', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '00001'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 7, 'count2': 7, 'count3': 13, 'count4': 43, 'count5': 266}}
column12: Nice location just across the street and you are on the beach.  A few nice beach restaurants opposite the accommodation who offer chairs as long as you take a drink or snack.  Great place to learn to surf on the waves.  The accommodation is fair, not too fancy but functional.

column6: {'id': '8439700', 'name': 'The Spice Trail', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 336, 'locationString': 'Arugam Bay, Eastern Province', 'latitude': 6.841487, 'longitude': 81.83218, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g3348959-d8439700-Reviews-The_Spice_Trail-Arugam_Bay_Eastern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.thespicetrails.com', 'address': '69th Mile Post, Panama Road, Arugam Bay 00001 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '69th Mile Post, Panama Road', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Arugam Bay', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '00001'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 7, 'count2': 7, 'count3': 13, 'count4': 43, 'count5': 266}}
column12: It was one of the most spacial places I've been staying in my whole life. Firstly, the rooms are amazingly beautiful, the shower is a surprize you must go see for yourself and ther is a little garden for every room. Secondly, the place is super welcoming an fun, there is a beautifule swiming pool and great jupanies resturant. but the most amazing surprise of all  is the crew who made this experience one to remember. Very recommended!

column6: {'id': '8439700', 'name': 'The Spice Trail', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 336, 'locationString': 'Arugam Bay, Eastern Province', 'latitude': 6.841487, 'longitude': 81.83218, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g3348959-d8439700-Reviews-The_Spice_Trail-Arugam_Bay_Eastern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.thespicetrails.com', 'address': '69th Mile Post, Panama Road, Arugam Bay 00001 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '69th Mile Post, Panama Road', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Arugam Bay', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '00001'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 7, 'count2': 7, 'count3': 13, 'count4': 43, 'count5': 266}}
column10: Right downtown. Perfect location to be close to everything and yet a little tucked away and feels peaceful.
column12:
We had such a nice stay at Spice Trail.

The rooms are so big, clean, and luxurious. Everything worked perfectly (AC, shower, etc.) and the room had all the nice touches (good shampoo & conditioner, drinking water, mini fridge, kettle, etc.). The pool was fantastic, and the whole place had such a nice vibe. 

The service was impeccable. Special thanks to Kasun for taking such great care of us. I’m leaving feeling refreshed and rejuvenated, and definitely plan to stay here next time I visit Arugam Bay.
column13: Great value for the money & excellent service

column6: {'id': '8439700', 'name': 'The Spice Trail', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 336, 'locationString': 'Arugam Bay, Eastern Province', 'latitude': 6.841487, 'longitude': 81.83218, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g3348959-d8439700-Reviews-The_Spice_Trail-Arugam_Bay_Eastern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.thespicetrails.com', 'address': '69th Mile Post, Panama Road, Arugam Bay 00001 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '69th Mile Post, Panama Road', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Arugam Bay', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '00001'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 7, 'count2': 7, 'count3': 13, 'count4': 43, 'count5': 266}}
column12:
Our stay in the Spice Trail - Arugam Bay has been wonderful. I’m travelling with my husband & brother. 
Our rooms have A/C and are spotlessly clean, and refreshed daily by the same friendly man. All the staff on site are extremely polite and friendly. The gardens are stunning. 
We have breakfast most days here in the hotel, Dharsan has been wonderful. Always available to help with meal choices and assist with any questions. He is a superstar. His English is great, a really lovely chap! ( I’m not sure when he has a day off, as he always seems to be available! )
It’s taken some adjustment to get use to the tropical heat here in Srilanka, when we booked I thought a pool would be important but we love to swim in the sea, the pool water is hotter than I have a bath at home. 
I can’t rate The Spice Trail highly enough, the staff and accommodation are fantastic. I highly recommend. We are very happy.

column6: {'id': '8439700', 'name': 'The Spice Trail', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 336, 'locationString': 'Arugam Bay, Eastern Province', 'latitude': 6.841487, 'longitude': 81.83218, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g3348959-d8439700-Reviews-The_Spice_Trail-Arugam_Bay_Eastern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.thespicetrails.com', 'address': '69th Mile Post, Panama Road, Arugam Bay 00001 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '69th Mile Post, Panama Road', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Arugam Bay', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '00001'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 7, 'count2': 7, 'count3': 13, 'count4': 43, 'count5': 266}}
column10: My wife has special dietary requirements which were never a problem with the staff always being helpful to find solutions for her meals.
column12:
Recently we spent a few nights staying at the "Spice Trail" villas in Arugam Bay and it was such a nice experience. 
The staff were great , the accommodation was amazing and the food served up by Prasanna and Dharshan from Little Bang Kitchen 👌

Absolutely beautiful. 
We have traveled trough Sri Lanka , this was the fifth hotel we visited, and none of the other hotels can be compared with this .

If u are traveling to arugam bay this is the place u want to book !

column12: Incredible hospitality from Leo and the rest of the hotel staff. Very friendly and always willing to help. The property itself is outstanding. Beautiful pool, and nice, well kept trees and plants everywhere. Our room was very big, clean and spacious as well. Only a 2 minute walk from your room to the beach. Good food in the restaurant too. Highly recommend 10/10.
column13: Our favourite hotel in Sri Lanka

column5:
{'id': '936487732', 'text': 'Dear Shagunv,

Thank you for taking the time to share your recent experience with us. We sincerely apologize for the inconvenience you encountered during your stay at our venue.

We are genuinely sorry to hear about the unexpected presence of a frog in your bathroom, as well as the challenges you faced in reaching our team. This is certainly not the level of service we strive to provide, and we understand how frustrating it must have been for you and your wife.

Please accept our apologies for the unavailability of our front desk when you needed assistance. 
due to the current low staff availability and the ongoing low season, we have adjusted our operating hours from 0730H to 2100 H, to maintain the quality of service and ensure the well-being of our team, However, we are currently investigating the issues you raised, and will take immediate steps to rectify the situation.

Your feedback is invaluable to us, and we want to assure you that we are addressing the concerns you highlighted to prevent similar incidents in the future. We appreciate your understanding and patience.

If there is anything specific you would like us to address or if you have any additional details to share, please feel free to contact us directly. We are committed to making this right and ensuring a more positive experience for our guests.

Thank you for bringing this to our attention, and we hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back in the future, providing you with the exceptional stay you deserve.

Warm regards,
Sudharshan
Team Spice Trail', 'lang': 'en', 'publishedDate': '2024-02-01', 'responder': None, 'connectionToSubject': None}
column6: {'id': '8439700', 'name': 'The Spice Trail', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 336, 'locationString': 'Arugam Bay, Eastern Province', 'latitude': 6.841487, 'longitude': 81.83218, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g3348959-d8439700-Reviews-The_Spice_Trail-Arugam_Bay_Eastern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.thespicetrails.com', 'address': '69th Mile Post, Panama Road, Arugam Bay 00001 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '69th Mile Post, Panama Road', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Arugam Bay', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '00001'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 7, 'count2': 7, 'count3': 13, 'count4': 43, 'count5': 266}}
column12: The venue was nice however when we came back from dinner around 9pm there was a frog in the bathroom. We tried to contact the owner about this but no answer which meant my wife couldn’t use the bathroom. After this I tried to go to reception but no-one was at the front desk and it was not even 10pm. The dogs then proceeded to bark loudly but no-one was around to pay attention. The frog entered our room which made it very difficult to sleep. Avoid this location at all costs if you don’t want frogs in your room. The bar was also closed for no apparent reason and the staff did not understand any dietary requirements. This whole experience has put us off Argaum Bay

column5:
{'id': '942759117', 'text': "Dear Mike and Vikki,

Thank you for your lovely review!
We're thrilled to hear that despite the quieter season and occasional rains, you found The Spice Trail to be a delightful sanctuary during your stay. Marshall, our friendly four-legged team member, is indeed a beloved part of our family, and we're glad to hear he made your stay even more enjoyable.

It's wonderful to know that you found your room to be spacious and comfortable, providing you with a relaxing retreat. We're delighted that you enjoyed the shower and found it to be a treat.

We appreciate your compliments on our food and understand that the options may have been limited during your visit. Rest assured, we strive to provide a diverse and delicious menu, especially during busier times.

Thank you for choosing The Spice Trail, and we look forward to welcoming you back when you're in Arugam Bay again!

Warm regards,
Sudharshan,
Resident Manager.", 'lang': 'en', 'publishedDate': '2024-03-18', 'responder': None, 'connectionToSubject': None}

column12:
Although this was quiet season and the rains were prevalent , The Spice Trail was a delight to stay at.  The staff were all friendly and relaxed but attentive without being intrusive.   Our favourite staff member was Marshall the meet and greet pooch. 

Our room was a little sanctuary and very spacious. The shower a treat.
the food was yummy and although options were limited , I am sure in busier times it would be fabulous.   
Would definitely stay again when in Aragumbay . Thanks @Spice Trail.

Mike and Vikki  (Melbourne, Australia)

column12:
Great hospitality from all staff and great property.
Rooms are very clean and the chef was exceptional in cooking
Stewards took care of our toddler as she did not like the cats .staff was very responsive and helpfully

On new year day there was some delicious food table which truly lifted our spirits and felt very warm and homely

column6: {'id': '4799724', 'name': 'Kottukal Beach House By Jetwing', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 117, 'locationString': 'Pottuvil, Arugam Bay, Eastern Province', 'latitude': 6.88221, 'longitude': 81.84444, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g608525-d4799724-Reviews-Kottukal_Beach_House_By_Jetwing-Pottuvil_Arugam_Bay_Eastern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.jetwinghotels.com/kottukalbeachhouse/', 'address': 'Kottukal Beach House, Pottuvil, Arugam Bay 32500 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Kottukal Beach House', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Pottuvil', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '32500'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 2, 'count3': 5, 'count4': 28, 'count5': 81}}
column12:
A simply beautiful place, totally tranquil with the sound of crashing waves!!
Excellent accommodation and a service level that could not be beaten, the team could not do more to help and everything is done with a smile and a greeting.
A walk along the beach is particularly amazing, saw no one and ours were the first footsteps
Absolutely amazing sunrise from the room, didn’t even have together up, although how could you not greet that!!

column6: {'id': '4799724', 'name': 'Kottukal Beach House By Jetwing', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 117, 'locationString': 'Pottuvil, Arugam Bay, Eastern Province', 'latitude': 6.88221, 'longitude': 81.84444, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g608525-d4799724-Reviews-Kottukal_Beach_House_By_Jetwing-Pottuvil_Arugam_Bay_Eastern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.jetwinghotels.com/kottukalbeachhouse/', 'address': 'Kottukal Beach House, Pottuvil, Arugam Bay 32500 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Kottukal Beach House', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Pottuvil', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '32500'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 2, 'count3': 5, 'count4': 28, 'count5': 81}}
column12: At Kottukal there are 4 rooms only so the staff can really take care of you in a personal way. All requests we had were fulfilled with a smile. We stayed 3 nights and ate 2 twice dinner which was of high quality with very balanced flavors. A highlight is certainly the location. One feels almost surrounded by the ocean. A nice plus is that one can use the facilities of the bigger Jetwing resort next door.

column10: If you’re traveling in a group with more than one room, arrange rooms in advance.

column6: {'id': '4799724', 'name': 'Kottukal Beach House By Jetwing', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 117, 'locationString': 'Pottuvil, Arugam Bay, Eastern Province', 'latitude': 6.88221, 'longitude': 81.84444, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g608525-d4799724-Reviews-Kottukal_Beach_House_By_Jetwing-Pottuvil_Arugam_Bay_Eastern_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.jetwinghotels.com/kottukalbeachhouse/', 'address': 'Kottukal Beach House, Pottuvil, Arugam Bay 32500 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Kottukal Beach House', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Pottuvil', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '32500'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 1, 'count2': 2, 'count3': 5, 'count4': 28, 'count5': 81}}
column10: Tuk-tuks easily arranged by staff for trips into Arugam Bay for those wanting the more active nightlife, bars and restaurants.
column12:
Looking for a nice place to stay close to Arugam Bay and having had a good experience at the great value Jetwing Jaffna, we were drawn to book the Jetwing property Kottukal Beach House.  We were not disappointed with our choice. The property is a nicely converted colonial era villa with a fantastic aspect and view of the coastline. From our 1st floor room with a balcony we were afforded a fantastic view of the sea and to hear the waves crashing onto the beach.  Our room was generously sized with a high ceiling and with a comfortable king bed and associated mosquito net.  It had a decent bathroom with twin basins and a rain shower. Plenty of hot water. Room air conditioning worked very well and added to ceiling fans for those who prefer, which are quieter and allow you to hear the sounds of the sea.

The property is small with only a few rooms, which assists the feeling of serenity but although small scale it is assigned with a couple of permanent staff members to service guest needs. A minor flaw was that there was no “official” way to make contact with them and there were no phones in the room or a bell to draw attention. One morning wanting a coffee (no kettles in the rooms) and after knocking on a few doors, I was forced to finally give up.  However, an hour later I was successful and finally had a delicious plunger coffee delivered to the room and foresightedly then preordered for the following morning. An a la carte dinner was also pre ordered and highly delicious curries were prepared by the inhouse chef.  We purchased a bottle of wine in town as none was available at the property, but they did stock beer. Breakfasts were also very good.

Other points to highlight include the generous gardens bordering the sea, the friendly in-house dogs and a decent pool. 

Would recommend if looking for a quiet and beautiful stay close by Arugam Bay (tuk-tuks easily arranged).
column13: Serene seaside property close to Arugam Bay

column6: {'id': '315685', 'name': 'Heritance Kandalama', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 5615, 'locationString': 'Dambulla, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.871171, 'longitude': 80.70803, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304133-d315685-Reviews-Heritance_Kandalama-Dambulla_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.heritancehotels.com/kandalama/', 'address': 'Heritance Kandalama 11 Kandalama Lake Front, Dambulla 21106 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Heritance Kandalama 11', 'street2': 'Kandalama Lake Front', 'city': 'Dambulla', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21106'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 109, 'count2': 139, 'count3': 451, 'count4': 1207, 'count5': 3709}}
column12:
Heritance Kandalama offers an exceptional experience surrounded by nature and stunning views, making it a beautiful getaway. The staff here are incredibly friendly and helpful, which seems to be a hallmark of this place. They go above and beyond to make guests feel welcome and attended to at every moment. The location itself is breathtaking, with lush surroundings and views that seem to blend the architecture seamlessly into the natural landscape. The boat ride offered by the hotel is an absolute must-do, providing a unique perspective on the area and a peaceful escape.

The food at the Main Restaurant was another highlight. Every meal was delicious, with an impressive variety and a great balance of local and international dishes. It truly added to the luxury experience, and it’s clear the culinary team puts a lot of effort into their craft.

On the downside, there were a couple of areas that could be improved. There was a 35-minute delay in the check-in process, which was a bit frustrating after a long journey. Additionally, the TV positioning in the 317 Suite room felt awkward, making it difficult to watch from the bed comfortably.

Overall, Heritance Kandalama is a fantastic destination with a few minor setbacks, but the beautiful setting, friendly staff, excellent food, and relaxing boat ride more than make up for it.

column10: Sunny days are perfect to visit
column12:
⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ Heritance Kandalama Review

As a seven-time returning guest at Heritance Kandalama, I must highlight their exceptional dinner buffet, which has consistently exceeded expectations on every visit.

Outstanding Dinner Buffet Experience
⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐
The dinner buffet is truly outstanding and offers incredible value for money. The spread includes:
- Exceptional variety of local and international cuisines
- Fresh, high-quality ingredients
- Live cooking stations
- Impressive selection of desserts
- Perfect balance of flavors

Value for Money
⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐
The dinner buffet pricing is extremely reasonable considering:
- The exceptional quality of food
- The extensive variety offered
- The premium dining environment
- The impeccable service

Having dined here multiple times over my visits, I can confidently say the culinary team continues to exceed expectations:

- Chef Sisira and Chef Danuka - You both have maintained the excellent standards I've come to expect from Kandalama. Your ability to keep the menu fresh and exciting while maintaining consistent quality is remarkable.

- Mr. Sarath (Restaurant Manager) - Your leadership in the restaurant has been evident across my visits. The way you remember returning guests and their preferences adds such a personal touch to the dining experience.

- Mr. Kasun(Captain) - Your attention to detail and the way you lead your team shows why the service at Kandalama stands out from other hotels I've visited.

The Warm Welcome That Keeps Me Coming Back

- Mahesha(Hostess) - Your welcoming smile and attentiveness make every return visit feel special. It's staff like you who make Kandalama feel like a second home.

- Mr. Prassana (F&B Manager) - Your oversight of the F&B operation shows in every meal and drink served. The consistency across my seven visits speaks volumes about your management.

The Team Behind the Magic

- Mr. Ranjith Kumarasinghe (Staff Training Manager) - After seven visits, I can truly appreciate how your training programs have maintained such high standards among the staff. The seamless service and genuine warmth of every team member reflects your excellent leadership.

- Chef Ravi Kumara- Your culinary expertise continues to impress me with each visit. The way you maintain quality while introducing new dishes keeps the dining experience fresh and exciting.

Overall Ratings:
- Buffet Quality: ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐
- Value for Money: ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐
- Service: ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐
- Variety: ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐
- Ambiance: ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐

As someone who has experienced Kandalama through different seasons and occasions, I can confidently say that what makes this hotel truly special is its people. The stunning architecture and beautiful surroundings are constant, but it's the genuine warmth and professionalism of the staff that has drawn me back seven times.

To each staff member mentioned above - you've not only maintained but exceeded the high standards that made me fall in love with Kandalama on my first visit. Your recognition of returning guests and ability to maintain personal connections makes each stay feel both familiar and special.

For anyone considering a stay at Heritance Kandalama, take it from a frequent guest - you're not just booking a hotel stay, you're setting yourself up for an experience that will likely bring you back again and again, just as it has done for me.

Warmest regards,
Sameera Silva

column10: Try the sunrise from the Pidurangala rock. Hotel will arrange the transport on request. Absolutely stunning views from the top of the rock.
column12:
This was my second stay at Heritance Kandalama, and once again, it did not disappoint. We booked a deluxe king room this time, which was exactly as depicted on the website - spacious, cozy, and complete with a jacuzzi shower that made for a relaxing experience.

The highlight of our stay was definitely the Coco Spa, which was absolutely amazing and well worth every rupee; I highly recommend it! Since we checked in on a weekday, the hotel wasn’t at full occupancy, so our first lunch was served from a limited set menu. While the vegetarian options were somewhat restricted and could have been tastier, all the subsequent meals were served buffet-style with a fantastic variety and I’d give the spread a 9/10.

One of the things I love most about this hotel is how it harmoniously integrates nature into every corner, creating a perfect escape for relaxation. Although our room had a stunning balcony view of the river, we couldn’t enjoy it due to the wild monkeys.

For those looking to explore, Pidurangala is just a 30-minute drive away. We left at 4 AM, and the roads were clear, with no wildlife encounters. This location is ideal if you're planning to do the hot air balloon ride, hike Pidurangala, or visit Sigiriya.

Lastly, the staff were incredibly friendly, with special thanks to Rebecca at the front desk for her exceptional assistance throughout our stay. Overall, it was a wonderful experience, and I look forward to returning with my family.
column13: Second visit to the Heritance Kandalama!

column12:
I had a wonderful stay at Heritance Kandalama in October 2024. The service was exceptional, with friendly staff, especially Ms. Rebeka, who made our experience even more enjoyable. The food was delicious, and I loved the three beautiful swimming pools available. We also enjoyed live music at night, which added to the atmosphere.

A highlight of our trip was the boat ride, where we had the chance to watch various birds. Our luxury twin room was excellent, offering comfort and stunning views. Thank you, Heritance Kandalama, for an unforgettable experience!

column12:
This place is a cracker of a hotel. From the moment you arrive and are greeted at reception, from the bar and restaurant staff, to those looking after our rooms and the guys working at the three pools, you are made to feel very special. All staff are very helpful and attentive and work hard to make sure everything is perfect. 

The bedrooms are simple but luxurious with everything that you could need. 

The building itself is like something from a James Bond movie, a complex hidden in the jungle with black faced monkeys swinging by the windows, and onto the balconies. The jungle and hotel are fused together, with much of the hotel, including one of the swimming pools, carved into the rock itself.  It is rather magical. 

We spent three days here and we hardly explored the hotel and grounds as we were off on safari and walking up Sigiria but there’s lots to do in and around the hotel. There’s a games lounge with chess boards and other board games if you want a little quiet time and there’s a decent gym if you want to stretch out your muscles after the long drives. 

The food in the buffet restaurant was excellent, we didn’t try the al a carte restaurant so can’t comment, but I’m sure it’d be great. If travelling with kids there’s plenty of choice so they can be brave, knowing they can always go back to their trusted favourites if getting a little tired and emotional. 

My only real criticism of the hotel is the bar area. The staff were fantastic, they couldn’t be better or more professional, but the bar area itself is a little soulless, it is large and somewhat cavernous which doesn’t make it somewhere where you want to linger and sip a cold beer. A really good pianist did his best to lift the area but it was a struggle for him. Some simple changes, some soft furnishings, and orientating the bar towards the views would have a huge impact and the bar could become a real hub for the hotel, where people could gather, relax and talk. 

But please don’t let my criticism of the bar put you off, this is a first class hotel, and I’d happily return for a much longer stay. And I will. 

M45, F46, S12, D8.
column13: A beautiful James Bond villain’s lair in the middle of the jungle

column12:
This is not a place to relax. Ever since I came here, the problem has continued at the reception.

45 minutes after checking in the room, when we checked the bags, they remembered that the bags were not there.

Then they ask what color and shape our bags are and how many there are. When we hear that, we feel doubt about the valuable items in our bags

After that, when we went on a dinner at restaurant the capacity of the restaurant was too high and there was a long queue out side restaurant. all they are waiting for dinner. Just like a church queue.

There is only a mismanagement of the hotel, they cannot manage the amount of guests that come for dinner . They could have increased the restaurant area or allocated time for those groups. They have no desire or concern to do any of that.

They have no desire or concern to do any of that.

We had arranged to bring a cake to surprise my son at dinner time
We told that to the hotel, so they prepared to bring it at dinner time

But they forgot that too. They finally told us after the sons left at restaurant.

I came here to relax, but I haven't found a place to relax since I came here. These are the problems.
Totally unsatisfied  stay at Heritance Kandalama hotel

column12:
We recently stayed at Heritance Kandalama and had a fantastic experience! From the moment we arrived, the staff went above and beyond to make us feel special with a warm welcome.

The property is beautifully designed, offering stunning views of the surrounding nature-truly a serene escape!

We were thrilled to receive a complimentary room upgrade from luxury to deluxe, featuring an expansive view of Sigiriya, the ancient rock fortress, over Kandalama Lake. The room was spacious and well-appointed, providing plenty of room for everyone. The kids loved the view, especially watching the monkeys play outside the balcony. We appreciated the comfortable beds and amenities, along with the eye-catching lotus decorations.

The hotel offered fantastic family-friendly activities, including pools and daily events like live oriental music sessions. It was great to have so many options to keep the kids entertained too!

The on-site restaurant(s) had a variety of options, showcasing both local flavors and international cuisine, making mealtime easy and enjoyable. They were especially considerate of different dietary requirements, providing helpful advice and information.

I would like to extend a special thank you to the staff of Kanchana Restaurant for helping us celebrate our wedding anniversary with lovely memories. A small request truly surprised us and exceeded our expectations. It was amazing! Thank you so much.

Although this is my first review of Heritance Kandalama, we’ve visited several times over the last ten years, and each stay has been a delight! The quality of service, accommodation, and dining remains consistently high, making it our perfect choice and go-to destination.

Thank you very much for your great hospitality, Heritance Kandalama!!!

column5: {'id': '974467997', 'text': 'Dear Thush ……Thank you for your wonderfully described review and for choosing Heritance Kandalama for your family holiday. We are extremely joyful to hear that your 4-day stay was an experience beyond your expectations. It truly humbles us to know that our team’s steadfast efforts to extend warm and friendly hospitality made you feel like VIPs and part of the Kandalama family. Our magical location, surrounded by lush greenery and vibrant wildlife, certainly adds layers of excitement to any stay, and we’re thrilled that witnessing an elephant drink from the river became one of those unforgettable moments that embody our connection with nature. It is a true reflection of our ongoing commitment to offering experiences that celebrate the natural beauty of this special place. We are equally glad to hear that the food exceeded your expectations and that every team member contributed to making your stay a cherished memory to recall, every time you think of Heritance Kandalama. Your kind words mean the world to us, and we eagerly await the opportunity to welcome you and your family back for another extraordinary stay. Warm Regards, General Manager', 'lang': 'en', 'publishedDate': '2024-10-19', 'responder': None, 'connectionToSubject': None}
column6: {'id': '315685', 'name': 'Heritance Kandalama', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 5615, 'locationString': 'Dambulla, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.871171, 'longitude': 80.70803, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304133-d315685-Reviews-Heritance_Kandalama-Dambulla_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.heritancehotels.com/kandalama/', 'address': 'Heritance Kandalama 11 Kandalama Lake Front, Dambulla 21106 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Heritance Kandalama 11', 'street2': 'Kandalama Lake Front', 'city': 'Dambulla', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21106'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 109, 'count2': 139, 'count3': 451, 'count4': 1207, 'count5': 3709}}
column12:
We had an amazing holiday here, staying for 3 nights and 4 days. During our stay, my family and my brother’s family created unforgettable memories. The food was exceptional, truly next level, and the service made us feel like VIPs. Every staff member was well-trained and professional, which added to the experience.

We came here to relax and escape our stressful daily routines, and we received much more than we expected. The nightly activities, especially the dance performances, were fantastic, and my kids are still talking about them.

Room 623 was a lucky find—it offered breathtaking views, and watching the sunset was simply beautiful. One unforgettable moment was when an elephant came to drink from the river while we were in the pool—an amazing experience.

There’s nothing negative to say; everything exceeded our expectations. For the price we paid, we definitely got more than we bargained for. I won’t single out any staff member because the whole team was outstanding.

Thank you for making our holiday so special and memorable. We can’t wait to return!”
column13: Stunning views, delicious food, and an exceptional staff. Everything exceeded our expectations and made for a truly memo

column10: Don't leave your balcony door unlocked as the hotel is in the jungle and monkeys love to come inside.
column12: Stunning views of the lake and mountains. The hotel blends into the natural jungle landscape and is quite unique. Amazing food and 3 different pool areas on different levels.  Staff are incredible and clearly love being part of the hotel. Apsara went out of her way to make sure my stay was pleasant and memorable.

column5: {'id': '973719324', 'text': "Dear Sue… Thank you so much for your heartwarming review. It truly excites us to hear that your stay was such an extraordinary experience from the moment you arrived. The unique setting, surrounded by nature and curious monkeys, indeed brings a special charm to Heritance Kandalama, and we're thrilled that you felt both immersed in the jungle and pampered with luxury. We're also delighted to hear that our chefs could accommodate your gluten-free needs and that you enjoyed the special desserts and pancakes made just for you. It's wonderful that the variety of day trips added to your experience, and that our team's warm hospitality made you feel like part of the Heritance family. It was a pleasure having you with us, and we can't wait to welcome you back for another unforgettable stay. Warm regards, General Manager.\n\n", 'lang': 'en', 'publishedDate': '2024-10-13', 'responder': None, 'connectionToSubject': None}
column6: {'id': '315685', 'name': 'Heritance Kandalama', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 5615, 'locationString': 'Dambulla, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.871171, 'longitude': 80.70803, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304133-d315685-Reviews-Heritance_Kandalama-Dambulla_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.heritancehotels.com/kandalama/', 'address': 'Heritance Kandalama 11 Kandalama Lake Front, Dambulla 21106 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Heritance Kandalama 11', 'street2': 'Kandalama Lake Front', 'city': 'Dambulla', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21106'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 109, 'count2': 139, 'count3': 451, 'count4': 1207, 'count5': 3709}}
column10: Definitely worth getting a Lakeview room. Don’t be deterred by the dirt road.
column12: From the moment we walked in to our suite we were extremely impressed. The setting is like no other, with monkeys everywhere, watching you through the windows. You felt as if you are in the jungle but with a touch of luxury. Some of us needed gluten free food and the chefs were very accommodating about that, making amazing gluten-free desserts and pancakes for breakfast, as well as many other foods. There is a wide variety of day trips you can go on such as Sigiriya, Dambulla cave temple, elephant safari and more. The staff are very helpful and welcoming, chatting with you about their daily lives and making you feel like family. Overall this stay was amazing, we loved it.

column5: {'id': '973718547', 'text': "Dear Sanidini,………What a joy it is to read your glowing review. We are absolutely thrilled to hear that you had such an incredible experience at Heritance Kandalama. Saraf will be delighted to know that he made the booking process smooth and helped you find the best deal for your family. It's wonderful to hear that our diverse and delicious buffet, along with the friendly service from our team, made your stay even more enjoyable. We are also overjoyed that you appreciated the stunning architecture and how it harmonizes with the surrounding nature. The beautiful sunrise and your visit to our Eco-park sound like the perfect way to experience the serene environment we are so proud of. Your kind words mean the world to us, and we can’t wait to welcome you back for another memorable stay. column6: {'id': '315685', 'name': 'Heritance Kandalama', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 5615, 'locationString': 'Dambulla, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.871171, 'longitude': 80.70803, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304133-d315685-Reviews-Heritance_Kandalama-Dambulla_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.heritancehotels.com/kandalama/', 'address': 'Heritance Kandalama 11 Kandalama Lake Front, Dambulla 21106 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Heritance Kandalama 11', 'street2': 'Kandalama Lake Front', 'city': 'Dambulla', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21106'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 109, 'count2': 139, 'count3': 451, 'count4': 1207, 'count5': 3709}}
column12: Incredibly good experience! Saraf guided us through the booking process and helped us find the best deal for our family. We stayed for all three meals, where we enjoyed the incredibly diverse and delicious buffet. Honestly, amazing food for all three meals. The staff was amazing. Incredibly helpful and always with a smile. The hotel is absolutely gorgeous, we enjoyed the beautiful sunrise. The architecture of the place and the way it melds with nature is out of this world. We went to the Eco-park too, that’s also within the premises. Overall, amazing experience, I only have good things to say about this place.

column5: {'id': '973717308', 'text': 'Dear Vinudie….Thank you for the rave review, which brightened our day. column5: {'id': '973550931', 'text': "Dear Chris…..Thank you for such a lovely and descriptive review! It truly thrills us to know that the enormity of the hotel left such a lasting impression on you, with its almost 1km journey from one end to the other. Designed by Geoffrey Bawa, the hotel’s bird-like structure, resembling an eagle with outstretched wings, was indeed intended to amaze. We're also delighted to hear that our wide range of dishes took you on a sensational culinary adventure. The setting of our pools, surrounded by the natural beauty of the property, certainly adds to the soothing and refreshing experience, and we're glad you enjoyed it. We’re truly pleased that your 2-night stay with us was one of the highlights of your trip, and we sincerely hope you can stay a bit longer next time, giving you a chance to explore more of what Heritance Kandalama has to offer. Warm Regards, General Manager.", 'lang': 'en', 'publishedDate': '2024-10-12', 'responder': None, 'connectionToSubject': None}

column12:
This is a massive hotel complex in a bird wing shape - they say you walk 1km from one extreme end to the other. Various swimming pools, hotel bars, evening music, and a superb restaurant (the best hotel restaurant I had across Sri Lanka). Huuuge buffet, even outside, including BBQ, huge desserts, many curries. And all perfectly safe to eat.

I stayed for 2 nights and would definitely stay again, this was one of the best hotels I had in Sri Lanka, super choice!

column12: I really love this hotel it is a beautiful hotel front line staff is superb Rebecca was a great help for us she was taking care of me and my husband from the begin g to the end she is really good in guest service she took care of us like here parents  what I love is the smile she give a for us that made a huge thing for our stay thank you Rebecca and also my husband was allergic to seafood so Merriam was there for the rescue it's was really helpful thank you both and also the room was good and love the nature and felt better about evwrthing

column5: {'id': '973323164', 'text': 'Dear Daydream……Thank you so much for your kind and wonderful feedback—it’s just what we need to brighten our day! column12: This hotel is blended with nature very much and we loved the stunning views of the lake and Sigiriya Rock. The wildlife around the hotel was a great experience for our kids. Specially the group of monkeys visiting the room balconies early in the morning. The food was really good and they had a wide spread on buffet, we loved everything here. Would recommend any family to go here with kids who love nature

column12: Our stay at Heritance Kandalama was exceptional. We experienced a beautiful piece of architecture in the hotel design, fantastic service, monkeys at our window in the morning and an infinity pool to relax in after a full days sightseeing. But the highlight of our stay was dinner with Chef Udara Sampath and his team. He introduced us to Sri Lankan cooking and educated our palettes in the  variety of spices used to create Sri Lankan curries. We were also taken on a tour of the kitchen. The evening with Chef Udara was entertaining, informative, delicious and an experience not to be missed.
column13: An experience not to be missed

column12:
We loved this hotel - the service was amazing and the design is flawless.  We travelled as a family of 4, recommend room 540.
Sagarika looked after us so well in both the resteraunts in fine dining and breakfast. Pools are well attended. The rooms are beautifully appointed and the housekeeping team really go to extra effort to make you feel welcome. Nothing is too much trouble for anyone.

column12:
Had the best culinary experience at this hotel. Includes kitchen tour, cooking demonstration and dining in the kitchen itself. This award winning restaurant’s kitchen is spotless! We were able to observe their operations during our entire meal and they are surprisingly quiet and very professional. Our personal Chef Udara and his assistant created the most delicious Sri Lankan signature meals. They made it look effortlessly easy before our very eyes and our table waiter spoiled us completely. To top it all off I was serenaded happy birthday by violin and presented with a scrumptious chocolate birthday cake. We were so full after our dessert that they kindly delivered the cake to our room to enjoy the next day (which we did! Yum!!)
Thank you Chef Udara for going above and beyond. I am, as we all are so very happy that we enjoyed this experience.
column13: Amazing culinary experience in a beautiful hotel set in the jungles of Sri Lanka

column5: {'id': '972934294', 'text': 'Dear Maria… Thank you so much for your valuable feedback and encouraging comments. We’re thrilled to hear that you enjoyed the refreshing welcome, the delightful morning visits from the monkeys, and the serene stargazing experience by the pool. Our nature wonderland is designed to offer beauty and tranquility, and it’s heartening to know that you were able to enjoy these moments. However, we are deeply disappointed to learn about the service lapses you encountered during your stay. The room you stayed in is part of our deluxe category, and we understand that not all guests may find the bathroom setup convenient. Rest assured, we take your concerns about the shower and jacuzzi seriously, as your comfort and well-being are our top priorities. We sincerely apologize for the lack of courtesy and attention during the issues you faced with the lighting, the insufficient towels, and the delay in serving your sandwich. We will thoroughly investigate and take the necessary steps to address these matters. Our service standards are consistently recognized for excellence, and it is disheartening to hear that this wasn’t reflected in your experience. We genuinely hope you’ll consider returning to Heritance Kandalama for a more seamless and amazing stay on your next visit. Warm Regards, General Manager ', 'lang': 'en', 'publishedDate': '2024-10-07', 'responder': None, 'connectionToSubject': None}

column10: Ask for extra towels or bath mat for the tub, it will be slippery.
column12:
Positive:
Check-in was swift, and we were welcomed with refreshments upon arrival.
The hotel had a museum-like ambiance, and the wildlife was incredible, with monkeys greeting us on our balcony each morning.

The pool, which closes at 8 PM, provided a lovely spot for stargazing in the evening.
Our room was comfortable, with a cozy bed.

The bathroom was nice, they have a bath jacuzzi overlooking the forest and wildlife. 
Breakfast was fantastic, offering a wide variety of choices.

Negative:
Where the bathroom had a jacuzzi, the shower was also part of it. You would need to climb into the jacuzzi to take a shower. This could be a health and safety issue, as it got slippery and they did not provide bath mats and enough towels, this ought to change for those guest who won’t be able to easily manoeuvre themselves into the tub.

The master light switches were behind the bed frame, this was an awkward position and not all the light worked when we first got into the room, we had to get engineers in.

Unfortunately, most of the staff (except those at breakfast) seemed quite unhappy and indifferent.

There was a lack of care in service. My friend ordered two drinks, but there was a misunderstanding, and no apology was offered. She also ordered a sandwich, which arrived about 30 minutes after my food, even though a table of eight, who ordered after us, received their meals first. Again, no apology was given. This was quite disappointing.

column10: For the elderly/physically disabled, I advice to book a room that has a bathroom with a walk-in shower, as the tub will be difficult to use.
column12:
Heritance Kandalama will always be my favourite place to go back to! It's been years but I finally had the chance to stay there again for 2 nights, and it's safe to say that they've maintained the quality of the rooms, the food, and the service. 

The staff were incredible, the buffet was awesome (we had two private dinners arranged, one for a birthday, for which the hotel staff did amazing work setting up the deco among other things). 

Had a good time in the main pool, too, and with the flautist, it was a surreal atmosphere. Overall, the ambience and the views are unparalleled!

The only tip I would give to travellers with elderly members or physically disabled members is to get a room with a bath that has a walk-in shower, as the tubs will be difficult to get into.

column10: Balcony is almost unusable due to monkeys
column12:
I had an unforgettable stay at this stunning lakefront hotel, where the serene views and tranquil atmosphere instantly put me at ease. The staff went above and beyond, offering warm hospitality that made me feel like family. Each meal was a culinary delight, with locally sourced ingredients that created rich, flavorful dishes. The room was spacious, comfortable, and offered breathtaking views of the water. Overall, this hotel provided a perfect blend of relaxation, exceptional service, and mouthwatering food, making it a place I can’t wait to return to.

Many thanks to chef Udara Sampath who prepared us special dishes and cook Supun for the excellent job at the grill.
column13: One of the best hotels to stay in Sri Lanka

column12:
Our stay at the Heritance Kandalama Hotel in Dambulla was nothing short of spectacular. The hotel is an architectural marvel, seamlessly blending into the natural landscape. Our room (number 508) offered a breathtaking view of the Kandalama Reservoir and the Sigiriya Rock. Waking up to that view each morning felt like a dream—it was truly heavenly.

The room itself was spacious and spotless, and the bathroom shared the same stunning view, making it a unique experience. The buffet was the best we had during our tour in Sri Lanka. Both breakfast and dinner featured a surprising variety of fresh, natural foods, which exceeded our expectations.

The hotel is filled with beautiful art pieces, and every corridor and floor showcases the richness of its architectural design. The main swimming pool also offered a mesmerizing view, and the poolside service was excellent.

We would like to give a special mention to the Front Office Manager, Mr.Chathuranga, who was a true gentleman and made our stay a memorable one. Mr. Shanthi also went above and beyond to ensure our comfort. The front office staff, along with these two gentlemen, served us with genuine warmth and hospitality.

Overall, Heritance Kandalama is a place of tranquility, beauty, and impeccable service. We highly recommend it and can’t wait to visit again.

column5: {'id': '971782463', 'text': "Dear Julia……Your kind words have left us absolutely thrilled. It's wonderful to hear that you found Heritance Kandalama to be the perfect wilderness escape, surrounded by the beauty of nature, complete with elephants, birdsong, and playful monkeys. The unique setting here is indeed a special part of the experience, but we are especially delighted that our team made your stay truly exceptional. Dinushi, Chathuranga, Chindima, Shahna, Mahinda, Kaml, and Apsara will all be overjoyed to know their efforts made your stay a time to remember. We take great pride in our team’s dedication to creating memorable experiences for our guests, and it’s wonderful when our endeavors are recognized. Thank you for your kind recommendation. It was a pleasure to have you with us, and we hope to welcome you back for another serene escape soon. Warm Regards, General Manager.\n\n", 'lang': 'en', 'publishedDate': '2024-09-29', 'responder': None, 'connectionToSubject': None}

column12:
An exotic wilderness escape from travelling. A quiet secluded eco resort tucked discreetly into the dense, green forest. Saw Elephants roaming near the lake, bird song & cheeky monkeys. However it was the staff who made this Hotel 5 star. I have to mention Dinushi from poolside Cafe Kachan
Cafe & waiter Chathuranga. Unbelievably friendly & efficient. Chindima the pastry chef supervisor & the effervescent Shahna! Mahinda, Kaml- executive chief on our culinary demonstration in-house. 
Apsara at the front desk. All displayed exemplary customer service skills. Highly recommend

column5:
{'id': '972218541', 'text': "Dear Francis,
Thank you for sharing your detailed feedback regarding your recent stay with us. We appreciate your insights as they provide valuable information for our continuous improvement. We are glad to hear that you enjoyed the breathtaking views from your Luxury Panoramic King bedroom and that our staff, particularly Imali, made a positive impression during your dining experience at the Asian restaurant. However, we are truly sorry to learn about the issues you encountered during your stay, including the condition of your room and the challenges with check-in and dining experiences. Please accept our sincere apologies for the delays you faced during check-in and the lack of refreshments during your wait. Your comments regarding the room's condition and the absence of essential information about hotel amenities have been noted, and we are committed to addressing these issues promptly. We understand that such experiences do not meet the high standards we strive for as part of the Heritance brand. We also recognize your concerns about the pricing of food and drink, and we assure you that we aim to offer a quality experience that justifies the cost. Thank you for your engagement with our team during your stay; we always aim to enhance our guests' experiences. We regret that we did not adequately acknowledge your dissatisfaction upon checkout, and we appreciate your understanding in allowing us to deduct the cost of your sandwich. We hope you will consider visiting us in the future to provide you with the exceptional experience you expected. 

Best Regards
General Manager", 'lang': 'en', 'publishedDate': '2024-10-02', 'responder': None, 'connectionToSubject': None}

column10: The infinity pool at the front of the hotel only has a few loungers which get full very quickly
column12:
We stayed here for five nights as a base to explore the cultural triangle. Our booking was through Booking.com and  as is common in Sri Lanka, we paid the full amount a month or so in advance. 

The hotel is reputedly one of the best in Sri Lanka, the jewel in the crown of the Aitken Spence Hotel group. Opened in 1995, it was designed to blend seamlessly into the natural environment; in this it succeeds very well.

However, the hotel is suffering from under investment and once away from the reception, bar and restaurant areas, this is very noticeable. And the room we were given also showed signs of dilapidation: very stained loo, cracked tiles on the floor and shower of the bathroom, no chrome left on the taps, a very scuffed bedroom  floor and furniture that looked as old as the hotel. 

We booked a Luxury Panoramic King bedroom at just over £200 per night incl Breakfast. The room was large with a wide balcony and an amazing view from the 7th floor of the Dambulla wing. Our King bed however was two twins pushed together with a groove down the middle (this was not what we expected or paid for), there was no safe in the room (one was installed a day later) and no physical information about the hotel anywhere in the room. We downloaded pdf files from their app but there was no pdf map of the hotel, no Beverage menu (just wine and cocktails) and no information at all about restaurant opening/closing times or which menu related to which dining area. In addition, there were no price or information at all about their main buffet dining restaurant. 

Our check-in experience was awful. We arrived just before 2pm after a very long drive. We finally were allowed to gain access to our room at 3.25pm. In the meantime we were not offered any drinks or snacks whilst we waited (why not???) so we ordered a very poor sandwich from room service for an exorbitant $15.5 excluding taxes and service charge. 

Breakfast was good although the buffet restaurant was crowded with queues for freshly prepared food and the service was hit or miss. Personally I hate buffet dining so we avoided the $24 per head (excluding taxes and service charge) and ate in their Asian restaurant which was much more personal, far less busy and the food pretty good. Imali our server there was wonderful and staff were generally good. 

Prices of food and drink are not cheap here (or indeed throughout Sri Lanka in 5* tourist hotels and restaurants). We holidayed in Japan in 2023 and found it far better value than Sri Lanka despite the fact typical Sri Lankans hotel workers earn around £2,400 pa. It made me wonder if Tourists and staff are being exploited to the benefit of shareholders...

In our first 48 hours we engaged with management on several occasions. They tried to improve our experience but after multiple conversations we just accepted our fate and tried to enjoy our stay as best we could. (Writing this last sentence is not a great advert for this hotel on which the Heritance brand has been built over 30 years and which the Aitken Spence group have subsequently expanded across the region). 

At check-out, the bill for food and drink was correct but there was no recognition of our unhappiness with our stay (why not???). However, at my request, they ended up deducting the cost of that awful sandwich.
